Description: Have a Flower Power themed Mothers' Weekend celebration with us at this amazing double height warehouse venue in Hackney Wick! Colour Factory is the Big Fish Little Fish East London home. World famous, award winning, Glastonbury Festival performing, family rave sensation BFLF throws the ultimate family event as they bring acid house, techno, house and drum 'n' bass to families with 0-8 year olds. Family fun for the post-rave generation of parents. Helping parents be responsibly irresponsible since 2013. DJ Luli will play eclectic 'rave' - heavy on the techno and trance. Multi-sensory dancefloor with glitter cannons, bubbles, giant balloons and parachute dance finale. Nifty Natty Craft tables with giant mural, themed crafts and playdoh table. Play area with tents and tunnels and baby chillout space with mats and soft-play ball pool. Optional fancy dress: Floral/hippy! Facepainters: our excellent facepainter Doxa Faces & Body Art will be on hand. Be transformed! Kids ¬£7 - Adults ¬£10 . Children must be over 2 to have their faces painted. Card or cash. ‚Äòreliably excellent' The Guardian ‚Äòcredible music...magical‚Äô Time Out ‚ÄòThe best thing we do together as a family‚Äô BFLF Regular ‚ÄòThe best day of my life‚Äô BFLF 6 year old attendee Five-time Winner of the Audience Choice Prize at the Family Arts Festival Awards. As seen and heard on BBC Music Biggest Weekend, BBC News, BBC 6Music, PopSugar, Evening Standard, The Guardian, The Mirror, Sky News, Mixmag, The Sunday Times, Glastonbury Festival, Victoria & Albert Museum and National Gallery. Please be aware that the venue is a warehouse type space and the crafts/baby chill area are on a Mezzanine level overlooking the dancefloor. This level is accessed by a single metal staircase. Traffic should stay on the right to keep flow going. Terms and Conditions Parents remain responsible for their children at all times. FAQs Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event? All ages welcome but acitivities are designed with 0-8 years olds in mind. Music is played at safe levels for everyone. What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event? Near to Hackney Wick train station and bus links. How can I contact the organiser with any questions? info@bigfishlittlefishevents.co.uk What's the refund policy? There is a no refund policy but if you are unable to attend you may sell your tickets to someone else. If well in advance of a sold out event please email info@bigfishlittlefishevents.co.uk so we can try and match you with someone on the wiating list. How Loud will it be? BFLF sets and monitors the volume using World Health Organisation guidelines - so that is it at a safe level for everyone, even the youngest babies, over the 2 and a half hour duration of the event. Though quieter than at adult events, it is still loud enough to feel like you are at a club. Most parents do not use ear defenders on their children but if yours are particularly sensitive to noise or if you want them to nap then you might want to consider it.
Title: Big Fish Little Fish HACKNEY Family Rave MothersWeekend 9 Mar 2-4pm DJ Luli
Subtitle: Award winning family rave for Mother's Weekend in Hackney with techno/trance DJ, crafts, bubbles, foam, balloons and baby chill area.

Description: Cali Swing welcome Brando Perez & Viviana Vargas back to London! Be ready to be amazed by this internationally renowned couple who has taken Instagram by storm. Brando and Viviana will be coming to London for their 3rd 'Vibrando Tour' from 9th to 17th March, and will be teaching the following masterclasses: Beginner/Improver Footwork Masterclass This level is ideal for all who want to learn Cali Salsa, and for all Latin people who dance salsa but have not taken classes before. > Sunday 17th March, 2:30pm to 4pm Improver/Intermediate Footwork & Partnerwork Masterclasses This level is ideal for Cali salsa dancers (you need to have taken classes before) and salsa dancers (Cuban, On1, On2) from Intermediate level onwards> Saturday 9th March, 1pm to 2:30pm, Footwork> Saturday 9th March, 2:30pm to 4pm, Partnerwork Intermediate/Advanced Footwork Choreo Bootcamp - Part 1 In our Bootcamp Part 1, Brando and Viviana will teach an Intermediate / Advanced footwork choreography. Be ready to be amazed! Brando is known for his originality!This workshop is opened to all students that are Intermediate / Advanced and has a normal capacity. Students that take Part 1 only will not perform with Brando & Viviana. They will learn a footwork choreography.Intermediate/Advanced Footwork Choreo Bootcamp - Part 1 will take place on> Saturday 16th March, 1 to 2:30pm Advanced Footwork Choreo Bootcamp - Part 2 This bootcamp is reserved for advanced students only, who have attended Bootcamp - Part 1. In our Bootcamp Part 2, students will rehearse the choreography they learnt in Part 1. Brando and Viviana will teach them how to be performers and will give them invaluable tips! Students will get to perform alongside Brando & Viviana at the Cali Swing Spring Party on Sunday 17th March (Performance time around 7-8pm, La Pollera Colora, SE1 9SG - students will need to purchase an entry ticket to the party) Places are limited. Students cannot take Part 2 without taking PART 1 first. Intermediate/Advanced Footwork Choreo Bootcamp - Part 2 will take place on> Sunday 17th March, 1 to 2:30pm Intermediate/Advanced Partnerwork Masterclass The Intermediate/Advanced level is suitable for students from Intermediate level of Cali Salsa - you will be expected to know Cali Salsa Footwork. > Saturday 16th March, 2:30pm to 4pm VENUE Mulberry Sports Centre - Anthony St, London E1 2JR MASTERCLASSES FEES Each masterclasses cost ¬£40 for 1.5hr The Beginners masterclass is discounted at ¬£30 for 1.5hr (no early bird or multi-discount available) The bootcamp (part 1) has a standard masterclass fee (¬£40) and may be purchased at a discounted fee (¬£5 early bird discount / ¬£5 multidiscount when purchasing multiple masterclasses) The bootcamp (part 2) has a standard fee (¬£40) for 1.5hr but it cannot be purchased at a discounted fee due to very limited capacity (no early bird or multi-discount available) EARLY BIRD Early bird prices are set until 9th February - prices will go up by ¬£5 on 10th February. (this offer is not available for our beginner masterclass or our Bootcamp Part 2) For example: If you purchase an improver/intermediate footwork masterclass before 10th February, it will cost ¬£35 instead of ¬£40. MULTIDISCOUNT When purchasing multiple masterclasses, use the Promo Code 'MULTI5' to get ¬£5 off per masterclass (this offer is not available for our beginner masterclass or our Bootcamp Part 2) For example: If you purchase 2 qualifying masterclasses before 10th February (Early bird) and use the promo code MULTI5, each masterclass will cost ¬£30 instead of ¬£40. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Please note that we reserve the right to reallocate students to a more suitable level if the level booked is inadequate. All tickets are non-refundable, and nominative. For more information on the masterclasses, or on Cali Swing, get in touch! www.caliswinguk.com / info@caliswinguk.com
Title: Salsa in London with Brando & Viviana
Subtitle: Cali Swing have the pleasure to host a 2nd series of Masterclasses with Brando Perez & Viviana Vargas from 9th-17th March 2024

Description: Please note the original date of this talk was Friday, 8 March 2024. It will now take place on the new date of Saturday, 9 March 2024. Join Martin Kemp as he explores the evolution of iconic scientific images since the Renaissance, and how these images have come to represent entire fields of study. From the iconic double helix, to the famous E=mc¬≤, Martin will guide us through various images throughout all areas of science, the stories behind each image, and how they gained their revered status. He poses intriguing questions about engineering images depicting the unseen, such as the COVID-19 virus or the rings of Saturn. Discover the role of icons in scientific contexts and popular culture, as Martin sheds light on the common features that unite these powerful symbols by examining the prevalence of icons in specific scientific disciplines, as well as their significance in communication and perception. This talk promises to provide a deeper appreciation for the visual language of science, arguing them to consider the profound role that iconic images play in shaping our collective understanding of the world. By booking to attend events at the Royal Institution, you confirm that you have read and agree to the Ri's event terms and conditions. As we're always trying to understand more about you and our audiences at the Ri, you'll notice we've introduced some optional questions when booking tickets. Please do take a moment to fill them in if you have the time. And as we're always trying to understand more about you our audiences at the Ri, you'll notice we've introduced some optional questions when booking tickets. Please do take a moment to fill them in if you have the time. Event image by BERK OZDEMIR via Pexels
Title: Icons of science
Subtitle: World-renowned art historian Martin Kemp unpicks the most iconic images in scientific history and discovery.

Description: Inform - Inspire - Celebrate - International Women's Day In celebration of International Women's Day (IWD) this year, LBTQWomen, UK Black Pride, Pride in London, Lez Meet and WeWork are thrilled to announce a special event on 9 March 2024 to spotlight, celebrate and support queer women. In line with IWD 2024‚Äôs theme of #InspireInclusion, the ‚ÄúInform ‚Äì Inspire ‚Äì Celebrate‚Äù event will provide a platform where queer women, non-binary people and our communities can be in and own their own space. During the event other organasations will join us : myGwork, MegsTalks, Diva Magazine. Learning and connecting within our communities The day of activities will feature meaningful opportunities to hear each other, our concerns and our challenges across the lesbian, bisexual, non-binary, asexual, pansexual and trans journeys. This will include panel discussions to offer a platform to those often underrepresented and unheard, interactive sessions around how our communities show up and show up for each other and an informal networking lunch. LBTQ+ women-owned, managed or supported activities and businesses will also be featured in a ‚Äúmarketplace,‚Äù offering participants the potential to discover new groups to connect with and support beyond IWD 2024. Uplifting wellbeing The event will also offer opportunities for queer women to consider their own wellbeing in a space which has them at the heart of the event, with opportunities to attend some wellbeing events. AGENDA 10:00AM - 10:30AM - Sound Gong Bath - small group session ONE*10:40AM - 11:10AM - Sound Gong Bath - small group session TWO*11:20AM - 11:50AM - Sound Gong Bath - small group session THREE* 12:00PM - Networking informal lunch & Market Place 1:15PM - 1:25PM - Introduction to the event1:30PM - 2:15PM - Panel - hosted by Lady Phyll, CEO of UK Black Pride2:15PM - 3:00PM - Panel - hosted by Char Bailey 3:00PM ‚Äì Break 3:30PM - 4:45PM - Pop up's from our community - celebration of all our community 5pm - 7pm - Networking drinks LBTQWomen, UK Black Pride, Pride in London and WeWork welcome all to join this ‚ÄúInform ‚Äì Inspire ‚Äì Celebrate‚Äù for IWD 2024 on 9 March 2024 at. Description: "There is a woman who dares to desire in you. She lives in you. She is ready to be seen and heard. She yearns to find her inspiration and be amongst women who can support and elevate her." We are so excited to bring to you the Women Who Dare to Desire conference in London for the second time, where you will have the chance to hear some of the most motivating and inspiring stories of women like you who fought for their desires and broke through fears and conditionings to reach for their dreams. It is time to celebrate these women and bring them all together in one stage, without looking at how well-known they are and how many followers they have, but simply looking and feeling their hearts. The conference focuses on inspiring you to connect to your deepest desires and motivate you to follow them. The whole day is an opportunity to uplift and honour each other, get inspired, create new projects, and network with other beautiful, like-minded women. You will dance, sing, honour your desires and collectively heal the wounds that stop you from following your dreams. And if you would like to share your story on stage, you can. How? You can have the chance to win one of the 6 x3 minutes speaking slots, which I will draw on the day when you buy a General Admission Ticket. Please select " Women who dare General Admission with the chance to speak" at checkout. But who am I? I am Debora, a passionate entrepreneur and mother of three gorgeous boys with a huge desire to inspire and motivate the world just like you. After receiving many " no" to appear on other people's stages and talking to many disappointed women who had the same experience and would tell me, " Debora, this is just as it is", I have decided to create a platform for any woman who has a passion and a desire to share their message with the world. I have immense trust in the universe, and I knew that this " no" I received differed from the others; I knew this " no" would inspire me to create my own stage to offer any woman who struggled to be heard. On Thursday, 4th of July 2019, the " Women Who Dare to desire conference" idea was born. The idea behind this project is to create a centre stage for women all over the world who have a story to share, who want to motivate and inspire others, even if nobody knows them yet, even if they have 0 followers, even if they have zero confidence to do it. 15 women will dare to speak their stories on the day, and many will brave the stage for the first time. Their remarkable stories will uplift you, elevate you and guide you to the possible next step in your life. During the day, we will have fun activities to help you connect to your INNER SELF at a deeper level, exercises to help you verbalise your DESIRES, express them, play with them and share them with other beautiful visionary women like you. There will be singing and dancing and beautiful performances. We will also go through a desire meditation and experience collective healing. I am so excited to have you there with us, either sharing the stage or simply taking part and shining your light. I believe in you! It is my biggest wish for you to start following your desires. It might start here, at this exact moment, with a decision to attend the conference. I look forward to meeting you, seeing you, hugging you ( I am a great hugger) and listening to you. With much daring love to you, Your daring host, Debora Luzi Founder of the Women Who Dare to Desire Conference xxx We will donate part of the proceedings to a beautiful women's charity that supports vulnerable women across London. IMPORTANT: Please note that we do not offer refunds.
Title: Women Who Dare to Desire Conference - LONDON, MARCH 2024
Subtitle: Join us at this exciting and inspiring women's Conference to awaken your desires and connect to your most exciting vision

Description: hyst area o‚Äôpivnochi Genre: breakbeat, house 4 Ukrainian DJs hit Camden London with multiple-genre sets to satisfy the tastes of the most demanding admirers of electronic music. Each of them will present a unique set created for the event in their favourite genre and will introduce to you the best bits of the Ukraine-rooted hidden gems. The Lazy Jesus is a Ukrainian DJ and sound producer who is always exploring multiple genres, recently focusing on ethnic sounds from across the world. He will come to London with the audio-visual project UA TRIBAL, which combines his passion for non-trivial rhythms with the musical folklore heritage of Ukraine.Yova Yager is a multidisciplinary artist from Kyiv, Ukraine, making waves in the world of electronic music. Her contagious love for dance music made her well-known to the Ukrainian and London club scene. And Yova‚Äôs unique blend of genres, including acid house, indie dance, breakbeat and techno has captivated audiences across the world. Velegura is a resident DJ of the most influential Ukrainian hip-hop community ALLOSYRUP. Her incredible selection of new school hip-hop performances quickly penetrated the hearts of listeners. Mingulitka is a Ukrainian DJ and musician, who brings a fusion of global sounds to London's music scene. She has many musical influences and loves experimenting with different sounds and styles, from jazz to electro. Mingulitka is a Voices Radio resident and played at EuroFestival Rave UKraine in Liverpool and at various clubs across Ukraine, the US, and Hungary. Entry 18+. Please bring your ID. we want to create a safe space for like-minded people who do not tolerate any kind of discrimination.

Description: Future of Endometriosis 2024 | Interest, Investment & Innovation Following the success of our inaugaral, first-of-its-kind, sold-out annual This Independent Life conference in 2023, we are thrilled to be back exactly one year on to host our next Future of Endometriosis conference in 2024! Join the TIL community in London for this exciting in-person event bringing together different voices and perspectives from across the endometriosis and women's health space during what we at TIL HQ are terming 'Women's Weekend' (International Women's Day on 8th, Conference on 9th, and Mother's Day on 10th!) Hear the latest advancements in research, treatment options and support for people affected by endometriosis and women's health conditions, and learn from leading experts including patient advocates, healthcare professionals, academic researchers, startup founders, and more. Together, we will ignite and elevate interest, investment, and innovation to make positive change a reality in endometriosis and women's health once and for all. Why For too long, endometriosis, and women's health, has not been taken seriously. Endometriosis affects 1 in 10 women and people who menstruate globally, a similar prevalence to diabetes, yet takes on average 7-10 years to get diagnosed. There is currently no cure, no true understanding of the cause, nor any forms of diagnosis available other than surgery. But there is hope. This Independent Life exists to help all people achieve health, wealth and fulfliment in life. From workplace talks, workshops and programs, to research, startup and government advisory, to community educational events, we help to bridge the silos, foster community and collaboration, and provide education, support and options to people with endometriosis and women's health conditions regardless of their background or where they're at on their journey. Future of Endometriosis will be a safe space for people with endometriosis and women's health conditions to learn, share, connect, ideate, and collaborate with others in the women's health space to leverage the power of community and create positive change for the future of endometriosis and women's health. Agenda & Speakers We have curated an agenda to bring you the latest and greatest in endometriosis and women's health. There'll be an exciting and informative mix of panel discussions and expert speakers, roundtable hackathons, networking, and free goodie bags worth ¬£¬£¬£ including products, discounted resources and options for support through our wonderful partners and sponsors. Please note for Zoom attendees joining virtually that we will start the meeting at 12:30pm GMT once all arrivals are completed. Recordings of the event will be made available for anyone who's not able to join live to accomodate time zones and accessibility requirements. Interest panel Investment presentations Innovation panel Who People with endometriosis, people with women's health conditions and women's health related issues, friends, family, colleagues, allies, anyone who is working in the endometriosis and women's health space and/or is committed to supporting advancements in endometriosis and women's health in some capacity. Tickets This is a not-for-profit event and our ticket sales allow us to cover our costs in leiu of big sponsors (hopefully one day!) Accessibility is important to us and there are a variety of ticket options, including virtual and pay-it-forward, to make the event as accessible as possible whilst remaining feasible (pay-it-forward tickets are to support someone elses attendance in-person or virtually all you need to do it purchase one and it will be assigned, and if you would like to request a free ticket through our pay-it-forward scheme please email rebekah@thisindependentlife.co and a member of the TIL Team will be in touch). Please let us know if you have any dietary or accessibility requirements when you register. Refreshments and networking drinks will be provided, please feel free to bring lunch with you if you've not eaten before. If you are no longer able to attend the event, please unregister to allow others on the waiting list to attend. Please note for Zoom attendees joining virtually that we will start the meeting at 12:30pm GMT once all arrivals are completed. Recordings of the event will be made available for anyone who's not able to join live to accomodate time zones and accessibility requirements. How to support We'd love to have as many supporting partners involved as possible to provide accessible and practical solutions to the endo and women's health community, so if you are interested in getting involved or are able to support in some way for this event, the community, or otherwise, please do get in touch directly via our application form here: https://forms.gle/4ufN6NMxJbedHgvG6 Previous conference reviews We hope to see you there! With love and gratitude, Rebekah Founder, This Independent Life -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Rebekah Lloyd is a women‚Äôs health and careers advocate and speaker, event and podcast host, advisor and investor, and founder of This Independent Life. After experiencing burnout and chronic pain, a 10-year delayed endometriosis diagnosis, and the resulting career and financial challenges, she started This Independent Life to help all women achieve health, wealth and fulfilment in life. She delivers education, events and consulting for workplaces, startups and communities, is a UN Women UK delegate, and an advisor and facilitator across workplace wellbeing, investment and funding, and research and start-up innovation initiatives. Her clients include global thought leading organisations such as Schroders, Barclays, UNiDAYS, Whistles, University of Cambridge and Imperial College London, and she is dedicated to using business as a force for good. In 2023 she independently hosted a first-of-its-kind conference on the Future of Endometriosis and Women‚Äôs Health and was invited to give evidence to the UK Parliament Women and Equalities Committee for the Government Women‚Äôs Reproductive Health Inquiry as a result of her work that was broadcast globally via the BBC.
Title: Future of Endometriosis | Interest, Investment & Innovation
Subtitle: Let's bridge the silos and leverage the power of community to positively change the future of endometriosis and women's health for good.

Description: An unforgettable evening dedicated to making a meaningful impact! We're hosting a vibrant fundraising event to support the first annual Vegan and Animal Rights Conference, a non-profit gathering aimed at fostering community, unity, and innovation within the UK's vegan and animal rights movement. Our conference stands as an inclusive space, nurturing a platform where ideas, campaigns, and tactics are shared to strengthen our collective stance of ending the exploitation of animals and creating a kinder world. To ensure the continuity of this essential event, we invite you to join us in our fundraising efforts. Get ready for an evening filled with excitement and purpose! Experience live music, followed by a DJ until late. Dive into our speed meeting event, an opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals passionate about creating a better world for animals. Share stories, ideas, and experiences as we come together to amplify our impact. Why does this matter? Because the conference isn't just a gathering‚Äîit's a catalyst for unity, a forge where campaigns are born, strategies are shared, and the tapestry of the UK vegan and animal rights movement is woven ever stronger. Let's unite in our shared mission at this lively and purpose-driven fundraiser, paving the way for the success of the Vegan and Animal Rights Conference. Together, we'll create a lasting impact and strengthen the UK's movement toward a more compassionate world. Sliding scale ticketing to increase inclusivity. #vegan #animalrights #veganlondon #vgang #veganuary #animaladvocacy

Description: Black Rise is celebrating International Women's Day in partnership with Rehoboth Property Group who will welcome us in their beautiful London venue. We are bringing Black women in leadership for International Women's Day to connect and also discuss why the Black community is significantly underrepresented in property investment. Black Rise, in collaboration with Rehoboth Property Group, is taking a stand to close this gap. Join us for a ground-breaking event designed to connect you and also empower you with the knowledge and tools needed to thrive in the property market. What to expect: We intend to shed light on the barriers that have historically limited Black women's participation in property investment and to offer actionable solutions. Our collaboration with Rehoboth Property Group brings together expertise and insights, creating a unique platform for learning, sharing, and connecting. Geared towards an intimate group of successful Black females, our event offers a series of interactive discussions led by seasoned investors and networking opportunities that promise to foster connections and community among attendees. This is more than just an event; it's a movement towards financial freedom and the creation of generational wealth for Black women. Set in a supportive environment with canapes and drinks, we're dedicated to making this experience enlightening and enjoyable. Spaces are limited, and the opportunity is vast. Register now to secure your spot in this pivotal event. Let's rise, empower, and pave the way for a future where Black women are leading figures in property investment.
Title: Black Women Connect & Talk Generational Wealth
Subtitle: An International Women's Day event aims to connect Black women while discussing the opportunities in property investment.

Description: Soundtracks of the renowned film 'Interstellar,' directed by Christopher Nolan, and brought to life by the enchanting performance from Mystery Ensemble. Hans Zimmer, the constant collaborator in his films and one of the greatest film composers of our time, is an Oscar winner, a two-time Golden Globe winner, and a three-time Grammy winner. Zimmer's original compositions will be reimagined for a unique ensemble of instruments, combining electronics and acoustic instruments Duration: 60 minutes (doors will open 30 mins prior to the scheduled start time and late entry is not permitted) PERFROMERS üéªMystery Ensemble The mysterious fleur of the concert will be created by the unique connection between musicians with the surrounding architecture & lights. Lights installation over the vaults of the 19th-century church and stately pipe organ help the ensemble to transfer the audience into the cryptic world of her majesty's the music. ABOUT Mystery Ensemble is a group of professional musicians performing unique programs on non-standard venues around the UK. Experience outstanding works from different eras, experimental music, tributes, and world soundtracks of films and series, as well as absolutely unique programs and immersive shows. All music presented in author's arrangements. With the possibility of independent choice of the program, unexpected locations, and flexibility of the format, our team of professional musicians is inspired to bring their favorite music to life. Founded in 2021, our studio of contemporary music has grown rapidly, with over 40 shows in the UK in its first year of performing. Our founder, Almin Alexander, has devoted more than 12 years of his life to the music industry and the development of cultural initiatives around the world, working with many outstanding musicians and musical groups. The ensemble's repertoire contains an incredible amount of music. Just look at some of the programs so dearly loved by our viewers: these are tribute concerts of such great composers as Ludovico Einaudi, Hans Zimmer, John Williams, √ìlafur Arnalds, Joe Hisaishi, or the minimalists' John Cage and David Lang, along with At the same time, the ensemble performs popular soundtracks from sensational TV shows and movies: The Witcher, Wednesday, The Young Pope, Harry Potter, a variety of Disney and Pixar films, Pirates of the Caribbean, The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit saga, Spencer, Star Wars and others. There is also the unique music of Enigma, Enya, combined with neoclassical music, or world rock hits, and tributes to the legendary Michael Jackson, Queen and the Beatles. For lovers of the classics, the ensemble collection contains music by W.A. Mozart, J.S. Bach, L.V. Beethoven, R. Wagner, I. Strauss, P.I. Tchaikovsky, S.V. Rachmaninov, and all key composers - classics. And much more. Every month the studio releases new programs and updates the existing repertoire. For some projects, the team gathers as part of a chamber or small symphony orchestra. Join us and experience the creative energy and passion that drives our team to bring music to life in unforgettable ways PROGRAMME Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Dreaming of the Crash Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Mountains Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Afraid of Time Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Coward Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Day One Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Gravity Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Message from Home Hans Zimmer ‚Äî S.T.A.Y. Hans Zimmer ‚Äî Cornfield Chase *The programme may be subject to changes
Title: INTERSTELLAR: Tribute to Hans Zimmer by Mystery Ensemble
Subtitle: –ê unique concert on March  9th will take place at 5 pm in the 19th century church in the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea

This spectacular Cuban Big Band includes over 25 members, and it's still growing. Orquesta Estelar play all the Cuban classics, at venues from upscale West End clubs (Valbonne and Caf√© de Paris) to diplomatic and cultural events. Description: Re-imagine history through a contemporary lens in this Saturday session with artists Annie-Marie Akussah, Tara Jerome-Bernab√© and Elyssa Rider. In the artists' workshop, inspired by our exhibition Unforgotten Lives 1560 - 1860, you will explore new techniques and a variety of mediums to create your own historically inspired work. You can expect a warm welcome, skilled and friendly artist tutors, plus the chance to try your hand at a new art technique. Suitable for beginners. Workshops suitable for audiences aged 13 and above. All materials provided. We are offering three workshops; you can sign up for one, two, or all. Our time being creative in the studio will be complemented by a visit to see Art at the Archive: Reimagining Unforgotten Lives exhibition. Spaces are limited so book soon! SCORING TIME; LANDSCAPES AS MONUMENTS. Image Transfer & Collage Workshop, with artist Annie-Marie Akussah Take a deep look into the technique of Image transfers and Collage, which lends itself to experimentation and visual exploration. Learn collage techniques and experiment with image transfer by piecing papers together in different ways and with different adhesive techniques, playing with visual perception in size and concept and different ways of transferring historical images and photographs. Using images from the London Picture Archive and the London Metropolitan Archive, we will explore themes of memory, belonging and landscapes as part of the Unforgotten Lives Exhibition. Inspired by the Unforgotten Lives exhibition and Art at the Archive response which unveils the stories of Londoners of African, Caribbean, Asian and Indigenous heritage who lived and worked in the city between 1560 and 1860; their experiences etched into the very fabric of London‚Äôs archives. About the Artist Annie-Marie Akussah is a Ghanaian London based artist, writer, and educator. She is the Lead Specialist Painting Technician at Camberwell College of Art, UAL. She has previously taught at London College of Communication, as an Associate Lecturer. Annie-Marie produced an artistic response for LMA Art at the Archive: Reimagining Unforgotten Lives exhibition. Find out more about Annie‚Äôs practice here: www.anniemarieakussah.com STORY SQUARES: WOVEN DREAMS Weaving workshop, with artist Tara Jerome-Bernab√© Multi-disciplinary artist Tara Jerome-Bernab√© hosts a workshop inspired by her ‚Äòwoven canvas pieces‚Äô where the participant will get an opportunity to weave their own story into a frame. Using a combination of found objects, foraged items and materials that are personal to the participant we will learn how to weave incorporating these materials. We will be exploring themes such as the art of storytelling, geo-politics, archives, ancestry and poetry. In many communities of our historical past, weaving was a communal act; weavers would share techniques and stories as they worked. The workshop will be an opportunity to not only create a piece of art but to also nurture a community and share our own stories during the process. About the Artist Tara Jerome-Bernab√© is a multidisciplinary artist, born in London of Caribbean descent. Their work incorporates compositions, experimental sonics and poetry into performance art pieces. Tara produced an artistic response for LMA Art at the Archive: Reimagining Unforgotten Lives exhibition. Find out more about Tara‚Äôs artwork here: Tara Jerome-Bernab√© - City of London DARING IN SILK AND LACE How to paint fabric, with artist Elyssa Rider Come join artist Elyssa Rider for a workshop on how to paint fabric! She will show participants her paintings made for the London Metropolitan Archives' Unforgotten Lives Exhibition, talk through her artistic process and then will give a live demonstration of how she approached painting the fabric of the garments. Participants will then be taught how to create their own acrylic paintings of beautiful trimmings and ribbons. No artistic expertise necessary, just bring a willingness to try new things! About the Artist Elyssa Rider is a queer Japanese and British illustrator and comic artist working in pencil, traditional paint and digital paint. Elyssa produced an artistic response for LMA Art at the Archive: Reimagining Unforgotten Lives exhibition. Find out more about Elyssa's artwork here: Elyssa Rider - City of London
Title: Art at the Archive Artists' Workshops
Subtitle: Re-imagine history through an artistic lens in this day of  workshops with artists Annie-Marie Akussah, Tara Jerome Bernab√© and Elyssa Rider

Description: This concert's music programme includes Bach‚Äôs piano Concerto no.1, piano Concerto no.5, Orchestral suite no. 2, Concerto for oboe and violin in C Minor, pieces for piano, violin, flute, oboe and his beautiful arias and choir songs. London based Klingen Chamber Orchestra, Klingen Choir and internationally known soloists Marianna Abrahamyan ‚Äì piano from Glasgow, Valeri Ayvazyan ‚Äì piano from Glasgow, Paula Gorbanova ‚Äì violin from London, Hayarpi Yeghikyan ‚Äì soprano from London, Narine Malkhasyan ‚Äì soprano from London, Helen Rotchell ‚Äì mezzo soprano from London, Nika Pinter ‚Äì flute from London, Hagop Jack Mouradian ‚Äì oboe from Bermingham, Sipan Olah ‚Äì conductor, tenor, piano from London will perform during this concert. The selected soloists are well experienced in baroque music and this is a rare chance for the audiance to enjoy them all on one stage during this event. During the event the will be a spesial exhibition of artworks presented by an artist Mariam Torosyan from Cardif. Free refreshments and snaks will be deliverd during the break of the concert. Don's miss the chance to witness and enjoy Bach's immiortal music performed by these splendid musicians in London. To find out more about us visit our website: kcca.uk

Description: Bar 7:30 pm / music 8:30 pm DUSTY IN WORDS AND MUSIC: A Celebration of the Life and Music of DUSTY SPRINGFIELD! A celebration of the life and music of DUSTY SPRINGFIELD, the iconic 60s pop star led by world class pianist and arranger JANETTE MASON featuring Dusty‚Äôs biographer LUCY O'BRIEN and singer-songwriter JO HARROP. An evening of classic songs beautifully re-arranged, and an informative book reading/Q&A giving fans the opportunity to ask questions about Dusty‚Äôs life and music. Janette Mason ‚Äì musical director: Janette has garnered a reputation for her stunning arrangements and has produced a hugely successful series of shows including, Wall to Wall George Michael and Aretha Queen of Soul. She has a long list of credits including performing with Oasis and Pulp to writing music for film and television. She is currently keyboard player for Tony Visconti‚Äôs Best of Bowie project alongside being Artist in Residence at The Exchange Theatre Twickenham. Lucy O‚ÄôBrien ‚Äì words: Lucy is a writer/academic and broadcaster. She is author of Dusty: The Classic Biography, She Bop: The Definitive History of Women in Popular Music and Madonna: Like an Icon. She played in all-girl band The Catholic Girls and is currently working on a memoir about punk and feminism. Jo Harrop ‚Äì vocals: born in Durham and raised on a heady musical diet of Nina Simone, Billie Holiday and Aretha Franklin, Jo Harrop cut her teeth as a session singer, working with a host of iconic artists including Neil Diamond, Rod Stewart, Gloria Gaynor and Enrique Iglesias. Her current release The Hear Wants is receiving huge praise from Jo Whiley BBC2 - ‚ÄúAn extraordinary talent ‚Äì delicious‚Äù. Simon Little ‚Äì bass: Simon is a session bassist from London. A graduate of the Guildhall School of Music & Drama, Simon joined The Divine Comedy whilst still at college and is still a regular member of the band. He has also been a performed with Clare Teal‚Äôs band since 2004, as well as touring and recording with The Duckworth Lewis Method, Maggie Reilly, and Duke Special amongst many others. Line up: Janette Mason ‚Äì piano Jo Harrop ‚Äì vocals Simon Little: bass and Lucy O‚ÄôBrien: author www.janettemason.com www.joharrop.com www.simonlittlebass.com www.lucyobrien.co.uk Media patronage: Londynek.net

Description: Who and what is allowed to take up space? How can we resist & persist despite everything? Join us for a workshop connecting our memories & sense belonging in Croydon, with that of the natural world. We'll start with a walk & talk around Central Croydon, documenting how nature persists in Croydon‚Äôs inhospitable built environment, using photography and drawing, and sharing memories of these spaces. We‚Äôll explore how important nature is to not only biodiversity but to local historical & personal narratives, as well as wellbeing, making connections between ourselves and our lives and that of the natural world. We'll then regroup over a shared lunch to discuss, write, draw & collaborate on a zine (self-published magazine) documenting our observations. Free sketchbooks and a shared lunch will be provided. Please let us know if you have any dietary restrictions. This event is part of This is Croydon, London Borough of Culture. London Borough of Culture is a Mayor of London initiative, with support from Arts Council England and National Lottery Heritage Fund. Turf aims to be a space where all are welcomed & respected. We ask all attendees to align with this spirit when booking and support us in creating a welcoming & collaborative atmosphere together. We ask that everyone is;
Title: Greening: the town in which we grew
Subtitle: Join us for a workshop connecting our memories & sense belonging in Croydon, with that of the natural world.

Description: Back by popular demand!! We are chuffed to be bringing back Catharsis on Sat, 9 March, 2024! For all those lovers of Electronic Dance music! Once upon a time, way back in 2019, we ran an awesome ecstatic dance event in Camden, called Catharsis! It was a celebration of Rave culture, and all things Electronica & Psytrancey. We ran this monthly event for a couple of years in Camden, right up to the start of the Covid Pandemic. And so we are proud and psyched to bring it back "due to popular demand!" We'll be including magical ceremonial grade cacao and hypnotic electronic music to connect us deeply with our dance and our creativity. No experience necessary. All welcome. Brought to you by: Ecstatic Dance London - We love to dance. We love music! We love to inspire, to connect, to heal and transform! *VERY LIMITED SPACES - ONLINE REGISTRATION ONLY, NO TICKETS ON DOOR!* Catharsis is about Liberation, Purification, Freedom and Fun! It's about getting in touch with the wild dancer who doesn't give a F*** what people think. To open up and make friends with our anger, our power, our passion, our playful nature, and our tender heart - all accompanied by a scorching psytrance and electronica soundtrack. ***Please note: this is a zero-tolerance drug and alcohol space! This is one of the very few spaces where Londoners can go out dancing on a Saturday night in London in a safe and clean sober space. Please respect this, and please don't come drunk or high as you will be refused entry or asked to leave. No refunds!*** üíú SEE ALL OUR UPCOMING WELLBEING EVENTS, RETREATS & FESTIVALS: https://ecstaticdancelondon.com/events We are super excited to be back offering Ecstatic Dances & Cacao Ceremonies on Saturday nights in 2023! Ecstatic Dance London - Pioneers of the Ecstatic Dance movement here in the UK since 2009! You are invited to join us for freestyle, expressive dance & moving meditation sessions. An Evening of Ecstatic Dance with No Alcohol, No Drugs - Just Music, Amazing Rhythms and Cacao! This is a unique sober Saturday night dance in London! No prior experience of dance necessary. All welcome. We also offer limited free crew space, scroll down to find more info and crew sign up form. Our Ecstatic Dance sessions have guidelines of: No booze, No Shoes, No phones, No Chit Chat, Move However You Wish, Respect yourself and others. (More info about what is Ecstatic Dance - further down) No late comers please. This is a shared journey from the beginning to the end and we aim to create a safe container for all dancers. If you are more than 30 min late from the start of the session, unfortunately you won't be able to join the session, please respect this and arrive on time. Thank you FREE CREW SPACES: We offer limited free crew spaces, scroll down to find more info and crew sign up form. -A unique conscious clubbing experience! -A beautiful, sacred, heartful, fun & safe space for you to dance freely in -Yummy, velvety tasting raw vegan cacao drink and intention-setting ritual -Superb sound system and optional silent disco headphones for more immersive experience -Vibrant people who love to dance and love music! -Optional fruit social to nourish you after the dance -Best Saturday night out and no hangover! At Ecstatic Dance London we LOVE chocolate, RAW chocolate-CACAO! We will provide complimentary Raw Vegan Cacao to superfood charge your dance with us! Cacao is the ultimate heart opener, it will give you energy, revitalise your BodyMind inviting you to express, release & unleash your creativity during the dance! Our Raw Vegan Cacao is prepared lovingly by Diana (who makes the best cacao in town for sure!). She uses ethically sourced, highest quality ingredients from Guatemala, directly from a reliable cacao bean farmer. Join us to explore Cacao + Ecstatic Dance as a potent synthesis for Transformation! ‚óà 7:00pm-7:30pm Doors Open/ Check in / Dance Warm up ‚óà 7:30pm-9:45pm Cacao Ceremony, Positive Intention Setting/ Ecstatic Dance SoundWave (No entry after 7:30pm sorry, this is so we can all journey together) ‚óà 9:45pm-10:15pm Optional fruit social to nourish you after the dance 1. Please come already dressed in comfortable clothing suitable for movement/fitness and dress in layers. Bring a set of dry clothes/small towel as you will probably get sweaty during the session. Toilets are available at the venue but there are no separate changing rooms. 2. We dance barefoot, in soft indoor shoes or grip socks. 3. a Reusable water bottle. Tap water & lemon water refill available at the venue. 4. A healthy snack to have after the dance. 2 minutes walk from Tufnell Park station (Exact venue details will be in your order confirmation email! Please scroll down in the email to see all details!) -Nearest station is Tufnell Park. 2 min walk from the station. Please check tfl.gov for latest travel updates. -If you are driving, please be aware that the venue is in an Ultra Low Emission Zone and you may be liable to pay the daily fee. -Find parking on parkopedia and use venues postcode. There is no parking at the venue. -There are bicycle racks at the venue to lock your bike if you are cycling. -Venue is accessible to wheelchair users. -Toilets are available at the venue. +Eventbrite fee. Book online or pay cash/ card on the door. CHILDREN: unfortunately these sessions are not suitable for children. EVENTBRITE ORDER CONFIRMATION: Email might be in the spam folder. Please check the email you used to purchase the ticket, might not be your primary email account. Do not print any paper tickets, we will check you in by your name. We also offer limited FREE *crew spaces in exchange of you helping us set up and/or pack down. (*Requirement - you need to have attended at least two of our indoor events before you can join the crew) Please complete the crew sign up form and we will get in touch: https://forms.gle/uXVr8kK9Eos7hjbK6 We do not offer refunds/ticket swaps for another event if you cannot attend if less than 72h notice if provided. You are welcome to pass on your ticket to a friend, colleague or family member however please let us know the date & time of the booked session, name and email address of the person attending in your place. Send us an email with replacement person's details to: youareyoubeyou@gmail.com If you are showing any Covid-19 symptoms, please DO NOT attend the session. If we need to cancel the class due to unforeseen circumstances, we will issue a full refund. If you have any questions please feel free to send us an email: youareyoubeyou@gmail.com ‚óà Sessions are facilitated and DJed by Seth Newman - the pioneer of Ecstatic Dance in the UK since 2009!  Seth Newman: As the founder of the URUBU School of Transformational Arts and Ecstatic Dance London, he integrates the roots of Humanistic therapies, Bioenergetics & Body Psychotherapy, Transpersonal Psychology and Tantra in creative and life-transforming workshops, retreats and trainings. As a coach, Seth is dedicated to helping people calm, empower and rejuvenate their busy minds and bodies to achieve the best versions of themselves. Seth brings a wealth of experience holding heart-centered spaces. His in-depth studies, trainings,  personal experiences of many therapeutic modalities such as Humanistic & Body Psychotherapy, the Human Potential Movement, 5 Rhythms, Active meditations and the teaching of the Indian Mystic Osho who he grew up with in India in the 1970s,  infuse his approach to living a creative, holistic & embodied life and sharing his unique offerings with others. Seth has been facilitating regular workshops for many years.  As a musician, Seth is very passionate about rhythm & drumming,  has an MA in Community Music from Goldsmith College, worked as a world music percussion teacher in East London schools for almost 20 years, created URUBU collective back in 2009 as a Live Music Ecstatic Dance experience with Afro-Brazilian drummers & musicians and started his journey as an avid DJ with a love for Afro-Beat, Cuban and Brazilian music and created an Ecstatic Dance scene in London and the UK. Seth has a life-long passion for 5 Rhythms and other movement and Ecstatic Dance practices.  URUBU has since evolved into a School of Transformational Arts - offering a variety of powerful  holistic body-mind tools and practices.  MUSIC - MOVEMENT - COMMUNITY!  Brought to you by: Ecstatic Dance London - We love to dance. We love music. We love to inspire, to connect, to heal and transform!  Ecstatic Dance is a dance/movement practice to  explore the exhilarating feeling of moving your body freely. You are invited to move, play, connect, sweat, stretch, sound, unwind, renew, release, improvise, transform. Be true to yourself, while respecting your body, in this space that we co-create together. Move your body, unleash the wild dancing self without caring what people think, claim your freedom, open your heart & touch the infinite! Our Ecstatic Dance classes create a safe and respectful environment that embraces 'all ways'. We offer a movement practice that supports your free expression of emotions and inner space through movement and music. Our intention for these Ecstatic Dance classes is self-exploration, connection, fun, healing, expanding human potential and community building through freestyle ecstatic dance.  Enter an open space...and with your bare feet explore the exhilarating feeling of moving your body freely. You are invited to move, play, connect, sweat, stretch, sound, unwind, renew, release, improvise, transform. Be true to yourself, while respecting your body, in this space that we co-create together. PRACTICE SPECIFICS: Warm-up:  stretch, move/dance and reflect on the intention for the dance to a gentle sound wave. The Practice:  freestyle dancing to a large sound wave featuring Live DJ set. Some guidance & facilitation will be provided. And then we will let the music, the community and our own inner space direct our steps, our movements, our expression, our journey. Relaxation: Ecstatic Dance usually ends with a deep relaxation. No late comers please. This is a shared journey from the beginning to the end and we aim to create a safe container for all dancers.   1. No talking during the dance (if you wish to talk, you are welcome to chat before/after dance outside the main dance space). When we dance without the chitchat, something alchemical can happen on the dancefloor. A unified field of Being emerges and we feel both wild and free, contained within ourselves And connected to something much, much greater than our individual selves. 2. Drug-Free, Smoke-Free, Alcohol-Free environment 3. No photos or videos, Mobile phones muted and out of sight 4. Care/Awareness for the co-created space and each other 5. Move your body however you wish 6. No spectating. Stay connected to your own body, sensations, emotions, and feelings. Ecstatic Dance is about you and your relationship to the Dance. Dancers feel uncomfortable when being spectated at. Come prepared to Dance yourself free from inhibitions! 7. You can dance alone, or with as many partners as (you) like to join. (If you‚Äôd rather not dance with someone, thank them for the offer by placing your hands in prayer position at your heart ‚Äì Namaste. Thank you, no thank you.) 8. This is not a pick up place. Please respect all dancers (especially women) and do not ask for anyone's contact details. If you wish to stay in touch with someone, give them your email instead of asking for their contact details. No means no. INSTAGRAM: @urubu_school_of_transformation, @ecstaticdance_london FACEBOOK: Ecstatic Dance London, URUBU, Ecstatic Dance Temple, Ecstatic Dance Festivals FACEBOOK GROUPS: URUBU - Ecstatic Dance London, Ecstatic Dance London MEETUP: Urubu's Ecstatic Dance & Moving Meditation Community, Ecstatic Dance Temple YOUTUBE: URUBU School of Transformational Arts WEBSITE:  ecstaticdancelondon.com EMAIL: youareyoubeyou@gmail.com URUBU - YOU ARE YOU, BE YOU! üíúSEE ALL OUR UPCOMING WELLBEING EVENTS, RETREATS, FESTIVALS: ecstaticdancelondon.com/events
Organizer: Ecstatic Dance London & URUBU Wellbeing Events

Description: You will see THREE films under the theme TELLING OUR STORY: ‚ÄòTelling Our Hurricane Irma Story‚Äô (2019) - Barbuda,10 minutes. The Be Foundation Trustees from Barbudan based International NGO The Be Foundation, share their Category 5 Hurricane Irma stories in a frank and honest short film, also exposing why they are so passionate about the future of their tiny island in the Caribbean called Barbuda. ‚ÄòTelling our Hurricane Maria Story ‚Äò (2018) ‚Äì Dominica, 8 minutes. The Waltham Forest Twinning Association Members and friends of the WF Twinning Association share their stories in a moving short film which captures some of their experiences when they were in Dominica as Category 5 Hurricane Maria struck. ‚ÄòThe iD Project ‚Äì My Dominica Story‚Äô (2019) - by Richard Etienne. 1 hour. Everyone has a Story to tell ‚ÄúOn the week that marks 15 years since my paps' passing, I want to gift you the film that was inspired by the great man. I give to you: The iD Project - My Dominica Story‚Äù. The multiple award-winning documentary. Rest in eternal peace - Richard Etienne Snr. 1953-2004 About the Film:Travel to the beautiful island of Dominica as one British man documents his journey of discovery and identity. Through a captivating narrative, he explores the birthplace of his late father and delves into the rich cultural heritage of Dominica.About the Director:Richard Etienne is a British filmmaker and videographer best known for his work as the official videographer to UK Prime Minister Theresa May (2016-19). His debut film 'The iD Project' won the Film Reel Award at the 2019 Caribe Film Festival and Best Documentary at the 2019 British Urban Film Festival. All ages welcome. Children must be accompanied by an adult. Light refreshments When: Saturday 9th March 2024; 12pm to 4pm Where: Acanthus Room, William Morris Gallery, Forest Road, Lloyd Park, E17 4PP. Travel: You are encouraged to use public transport - bus 123, or to Bell Corner - 34,97, 215,275,357 or SL1. The nearest tube stations are Walthamstow Central and Blackhorse Road (Victoria Line).
Organizer: Waltham Forest, Antigua & Barbuda and Dominica Twinning Association
Title: The iD Project ‚Äì My Dominica Story.  An award winning film
Subtitle: Come and be captivated by a young British man‚Äôs journey of discovery and identity to Dominica at The iD Project film screening on 9th March.

Description: Celebrating women all over the world coming together on International Women's Day. This year's theme is #inspire_inclusion Location: Taking place in the large community room at the Hub in the middle of Lordship Rec, by the lake. It will begin in daylight and we will walk out through the park together at the end. Please arrive promptly so we can start on time and you can give yourself a few moments to ground and settle. Spaces are limited & numbers are need for the cacoa so please book in advance: pay what you can as a donation towards costs (¬£15 is suggested but don't let money be a barrier to coming along) What to bring: Bring an open heart & mind. Wear comfortable clothing and bring a journal & pen if you have one. (I will bring extras so don't worry if you forget or dont have one). Yoga mats will be provided if you want to lie down for the guided visualisation at the end. This is a structured workshop designed to inspire, connect & empower. You will leave feeling recharged in body & spirit. The programme will take us through a series of experiences that connect us to our inner wisdom and strength. And to each other. Event programme: Celebrating women all over the world coming together on International Women's Day. This year's theme is #inspire_inclusion 17:00 Introductions & Presentation: a slideshow of women all over the world who refuse to be silent and demand change 17:30 Journalling Exercise: Feminine Energy Archetypes - discover your inner strengths 17.50 Refresh & nurture yourself: A Cacao sharing - enjoy! 18:15. Empowering tools for your survival kit - Affirmations & other tips 18:40 Express yourself - move your body & enjoy 19:00 Relaxing, guided visualisation 19.20 Closing circle On celebrating diversity: ‚ÄúIn our work and in our living, we must recognize that difference is a reason for celebration and growth, rather than a reason for destruction," Audrey Lorde told Claudia Tate in Black Women Writers at Work. On Unity: ‚ÄúIt is not our differences that divide us. It is our inability to recognize, accept, and celebrate those differences," Lorde wrote in Sister Outsider: Essays and Speeches.
Title: Women's workshop - International Women's Day 2024
Subtitle: Inspired by International Women's Day, join this workshop to connect with other women & enjoy your feminine energy & power. Recharge!

Description: On the day we'll have contributions from: Dr Tamica Lawrence - GynaecologistPresentation 1: Medicine and Menopause, including busting the myths about HRT (with Q&A)Michelle Johnson - Author and Life CoachPresentation 2: Managing your Mental Health during Menopause (with Q&A)Denise Campbell - Women's Coaching Personal Trainer SpecialistPresentation 3: Movement session along with nutritional and exercise advice (with Q&A)Caroline Jarrett - Holistic Health SpecialistFounder of Rays of Light Coaching and support services. She'll be providing lifestyle management tips.We'll also be hosting a 'Hearing from our Men' segment with Tricky Nicky where we hear about the journey from a man's perspective of living with women on their Menopause journey!! Entertainment will be provided by: Mr Cee Presenting our new Gameshow called "Mi na lie to you!!"AMJA Unabashedly - PoetSyliva Tella - Lovers Rock Queen Music by DJ PiperHosted by DJ BlazeThe price includes Welcome Pastries, Brunch and Snacks throughout the day!! When buying your ticket, please inform the Organisers of any special dietary requirements so we can accommodate you.There will be Stalls where you can buy all your favourite things.... Contacts for Information:BLAZE: 07956 548781SARAH: 07958 338564 GENERAL INFORMATION: Menopause & Me - International Women's Day 2024 Edition The Let's Talk Show and Venus Promotions are back again to host another empowering event of wellness and womanhood!! And what better time to do so as we celebrate International Women's Day at the Grand Union Community Hub in London, UK. This in-person gathering is all about embracing and understanding the menopause journey. Connect with other women, share experiences, gain valuable insights from experts in the field and be entertained with poetry, a funny game show and entertainment from renowned reggae artist, Sylvia Tella! Also let's hear from the men - what's their perspective? And if that's not enough, all snacks, food and drinks are included in the price!! It's time to break the taboo and embrace this natural phase of life together. Don't miss this special edition of Menopause & Me! See you there....
Organizer: The Let's Talk Show and Venus Promotions
Title: Menopause & Me - International Women's Day 2024 Ed
Subtitle: Celebrate International Women's Day at Menopause & Me,  where we embrace the power of women and  discuss the menopause experience...

Description: Non-member fees are now re-introduced at ¬£5 per yaji from March 2024. First timers can attend for free. Please select the appropriate ticket option. ===== Details forthcoming. Room: B102 Please note, timings are subject to change and may not reflect the proceedings on the actual day.  YAJI (1300-1500) The yaji will be open to all qin friends. REHEARSAL TIME (1500-1700) This time is set aside for rehearsals. Information will be sent out to particpants in due course. IN-PERSON ATTENDANCE INFO (COVID-19) Even though Covid-19 restrictions have been largely lifted, we advise everyone to be cautious. DO NOT ATTEND IN PERSON if you test positive for Covid or are displaying Covid symptoms. It is everyone's responsibility to keep everyone else safe and healthy. Those who attend in person are expected to be fully vaccinated. We would further advise wearing face masks (at least when travelling on public transport) and to keep hygiene and cleanliness throughout attendance. We also encourage players to bring their own instruments if they wish to do so (there will be a sharing qin available on the day). We plan to provide hand-sanitisers on the day, but toilet and washroom facilities will be nearby. GENERAL INFO Please do not post or perform material that is inappropriate, abusive, unlawful, disruptive, or completely unrelated to the yaji or guqin music: failure to comply will result in being kicked out of the meeting immediately and (if applicable) disciplinary action for members. The hosts and moderators have the right to use to their discretion to maintain order within the meeting by muting and expelling any participant or audience member without warning for not complying with the rules set out or causing disruptive behaviour. Privacy disclaimer: by participating in performance in this yaji, you in effect agree to being recorded or screen-shot, and to the recorded material and/or images being used by the Society to promote or advance its aims (for use outside this scope, the society will always ask for individual permissions before doing so or provide the reason in advance). If you disagree with this you must either tell us in advance so we can exclude you from any edited clips, or not actively participate in performing (esp. for livestreamed events where it is not possible to redact live footage), etc. Audience members not participating and who do not wish to be recorded/screenshot must turn their video and sound feed off and not use their actual name (it is their responsibility to do this as we cannot do these for them). If the ZOOM feed is to be recorded or livestreamed, this will be stated in the agenda or description of the event. MEMBERSHIP INFO Existing members are reminded that they may renew their membership directly on EB, or via another method. Non-members may join the LYQS before the yaji by filling in the application form and paying their dues. You may also apply for or renew your membership now by paying the membership dues on EB and then filling out the online application form by requesting it from the Secretary. It is strongly encouraged that membership fees and renewals be settled no later than the day before the event. This is so we have time to send you the email and details about the event as we would be busy on the day and may not have time to monitor EB for late subscription confirmations, etc. If you do this after the deadline, you must contact us directly to inform us of your actions so we are aware. Non-member fees are now re-introduced at ¬£5 per yaji from March. Please note: paying via EB incurs its own fees in addition to our membership rates. If you do not wish to pay these fees you must apply/renew via another method agreed with the Secretary during the application process BEFORE THE DAY OF THE EVENT. Overseas membership applications and renewal subscription fee payments should be done via EB as it is quicker and easier to process than via PayPal. Contacts Email ÈÉµÁÆ±Ôºöinfo@ukchinesemusic.com WeChat ÂæÆ‰ø°Ôºöelaine367523 [General enquiries] Dr Cheng Yu: chengyu@ukchinesemusic.com; 0788 089 6003 [Membership enquiries, registration of piece for first round, etc via Secretary] Mr Julian Joseph: jmgjoseph@btinternet.com or jmgjoseph@googlemail.com

Description: This event is for aspirational and progressive younger and older women alike. You who are open to new connections, guidance, transformation, upliftment, wisdom, change, growth, clarity, direction, motivation, inspiration and opportunities. You will leave this event feeling more alive. clear, focused, reignited, recharged, refreshed , rekindled, reinvigorated and rejuvinatated. You will be reborn and renewed. Making new friends and connections on the way because this event also incorporates quick guided networking too:) We aim to have regular, what you saying events? Covering different themes and topics. Sponsors, stall holders/product sellers, male and female speakers, people like you with something to say are wanted for future, what you saying? events. See bottom of flyer for more. This all female special 'What you saying?' event has 11 speakers - each speaking for ten minutes, on a topic that they are passionate about. We will listen to three to four speakers at a time and then have ten minute, quick guided, networking breaks; then back to the talks. Hannah Spence, CEO of Clockflower Solution As a mumpreneur, Hannah brings a unique perspective, showcasing how mothers can leverage their skills to succeed in the digital world. Join Hannah in her talks to discover the secrets of navigating career shifts, crafting a powerful online presence, and embracing the entrepreneurial spirit of being a mumpreneur. https://www.linkedin.com/in/hannahespence/ Ugo Chijiutomi is known as The Eagle and the Chief Encour-aging Officer.  She is a certified Integrative Life Coach, A Neuro-Linguistic Pro- gramming (NLP) practitioner, an Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT) Practi- tioner, and a clinical psychodynamic Psychotherapist-in-training. Before tran- siting as a Life Coach and Therapist, Ugo Chijiutomi studied BA(Hons) in Busi- ness Management and MSc in International Business Economics at the University of Westminster. Ugo is very passionate about transforming the lives of her clients as she transforms their minds, so they soar like the EAGLES that they are. As she believes that we were all made to fly.  https://ugochijiutomi.com/ Sarisha Naidoo, a former lawyer and compliance consultant, is a dedicated coach and mentor with a passion for guiding individuals and businesses toward their highest potential. Her expertise in law and compliance serves as a foundation for empowering others to embrace growth, overcome challenges, and achieve their goals. In my talk on "Discovering Your Indomitable Inner Power," I'll delve into the challenges many of us face when it comes to staying motivated and committed to our goals. Have you ever started with great enthusiasm, only to falter along the way? I'll guide the audience in unlocking their WHY POWER, the force that goes beyond willpower and fuels their unrelenting passion and drive. http://www.navigatelifecoach.com/ A Polish-British entrepreneur with 15+ years in tech and cybersecurity, founder of Kamreno Global Marketing Agency, and author of the 'Hector & Friends' series, fostering empathy and critical thinking in children. Her work has earned notable recognitions, including the University of Warsaw's Entrepreneur of the Year and finalist in Venice's BOLD Awards III. "From Marketer to Mentor: Leveraging Professional Skills for Social Impact" Renata will share her transition from marketing to mentorship, demonstrating how professional skills can serve social good. This journey reveals the unexpected ways we can use our expertise to inspire and empower the next generation. http://www.kamreno.com/ Siliana Coelho is a One of the first influencer Sickle Cell Advocates to take her pain and vulnerability online showing millions how difficult sickle cell can be without making it negative. She has shown resilience, strength and determination throughout the years. She also has a young daughter and is willing to talk about all aspects of living with sickle cell. https://www.instagram.com/angolancvndy/ Sharae is a fashion model, stylist and influencer with several influential channels on Instagram. Sharae has a collective Instagram audience of 48k. Sharae will give a talk about styling, fashion and being a fashion influencer. https://www.instagram.com/shansharae/ Mihaela Sugar I will speak about my experience of being a young woman in a male-dominated environment. The presentation will be focused on helping women to find the courage and the determination to start that business they have been thinking of for a long time or to find the courage to say no to an abusive workplace, it doesn't matter the end goal, the main thing is to use my story and what I do to help you get out of your head. https://sugarsproperty.co.uk/ New Bee Jane (Jane Cuva) A couple of life events led me to where I am today and that is discovering a song writing ability and the true power of music/ our thoughts/ words and emotions (energy, frequency and vibration) and how the human body is the greatest technology we posses.I desire to be a bridge that unites music with science and healing technologies (both new and ancient ); to incorporate ancient wisdom - to share as I learn these gifts with humanity‚Ä¶ where they rightfully belong.I AM going to be sharing the work of present day scientists whose work and technologies will transform our lives and the planet we live on. They are all connected.  http://www.newbeejane.com/ Azzaya Batbayar is a digital entrepreneur in financial education who runs a women empowerment project. She started her career working in financial regulation but quickly realised the glaring gender gap in senior roles and the constrictions of corporate life on personal time. In search of time freedom and financial independence, she transitioned into entrepreneurship. Today, she passionately empowers women globally, enabling them to unlock their full potential and attain financial autonomy.Talk:From her early years, Azzaya contended with self-confidence struggles, marked by her reserved and introverted nature. Yet, upon entering the world of entrepreneurship, propelling her towards an abundance of confidence and an emergence as a compelling public speaker. Azzaya will be sharing her secret to gaining self-confidence and transformative power of unwavering belief. You can do, be or have anything and everything - if you can believe.https://instagram.com/azzaya.batbaya Jael Spooner is an accomplished Property Developer,Entrepreneur and Investor. Jael has created a multimillion-poundportfolio leveraging a variety of investment strategiessuch as Rent to rent, Lease option, HMO & BRR. Jael will speak about the 7 laws of wealth. https://www.instagram.com/jaelspooner/ Nicole Babb I AM a mindfulness therapist. With over 15 years experience within Mental Health.Specialising in the healing & balancing of Mind Body & Spirit.I help people learn to meditate and live more present, aware lives. Through mindfulness, I empower & uplift people to live with more intention and joy, enabling them to find calm & clarity in the midst of their busy lives. https://www.njbabb.com/  F√©e Uhssi is a London-based Franco-Nigerian ethical fashion designer, artist, art and colour therapist, wellness coach, and community activist. She believes in the healing power of arts and and regularly offers workshops, events, and experiences to promote wellness, and better mental health through creativity.F√©e is passionate about empowering others, particularly women and mothers, and promoting sisterhood, community spirit and celebrate unity in diversity. F√©e  will share her vision of a healthier community and the central role that creativity and art play in promoting positivity and meaningful connections. https://www.instagram.com/feeuhssi/ *MALE AND FEMALE SPEAKERS WANTED AND WELCOME:) *Note - Driving to the event is not recommended because parking can be difficult. Description: Hostess: Ivy Join us to socialise like a royal, in an elegant and relaxed singles mix and mingle while enjoying luscious cocktails at the most exclusive venue in the heart of London The event will not have any loud music, making the environment perfect for meaningful long conversations that will allow you to connect with the other attendees and get to know them! Whether you are looking for a partner or just to meet and connect with other people who are at the same phase of life, this the event for you! You never know who you meet in this evening and that is the beauty of it! You may find a friend forever, a party buddy, a partner in crime or a partner in life! Since this is a mix and mingle and not a speed dating there is no age range- in a social pool everybody is welcome and you can choose to speak to whoever you fancy. Connect with like minded people and open your social circle, enjoy chatting about anything and everything, with those you like, for as long as you like while sipping on the best cocktails in town made by award-winning mixologists. If you find somebody who you think you have a connection with, dare to ask their contact details right then and there... like the old times ;) Oh! and you don't need to ask the awkward question: 'so are you single?' because they all will be! You are welcome to arrive solo- most people do- or with friends, we will be there to welcome you, make you feel comfortable and act as the perfect glue among those who wish to. Attendees from past events always feel welcome and energised after our events. Our reputation says that we make the best events in London - so come and check by yourself! Home Grown is the private members‚Äô club, not open usually to the public, set in a stunning six story Georgian building in the heart of Marylebone and part of the Home House Collection which exudes quality, sophistication and style.   Hosting our event at Home Grown members club, with its home away-from-home atmosphere, is everything you could possibly want on  a Saturday evening  This is a unique opportunity to visit the venue which should not be missed! How to find us: When you arrive please ask to be directed to Marianna's Events area/Ivy Any issue on the night feel free to contact Ivy: 07308887892 Please Note: -Tickets need to be bought online and are not available at the door -Tickets are valid for entry till midnight -Dress code: Smart/ Elegant/Glamorous ( ripped jeans, t-shirts, hoodies, sportwear, sportshoes or trainers are not allowed) -A valid proof of ID (European Passport, Driving License, or Passport) is required upon arrival independently of the age for security reasons For general inquires or difficulties with your ticket booking feel free to e-mail us at benetoupromotions@gmail.com or call Marianna on: 07949526733

Description: Ever wanted to be a fly on the wall? See what zookeepers get up to after hours? The panic in a teacher's lounge? Explore the web of intrigue in your local leisure centre? One of London's top improv comedy groups, Michelle lifts the lid on a location of YOUR choosing! See everyday places in a new light, stuffed with a whirlwind of absurd characters, emotional confrontations and quick-witted comedy from start to finish. The Improvised Comedy Musical. Music Box makes up a different one-act comedy musical every show based on the suggestions of a 'title' and a 'location' from the audience. Songs and lyrics are plucked from thin air. Stories and characters are created on the spot. Past musicals have taken place inside a Wetherspoons, the Orient Express, The Depths of Hell, a World War II bunker and on board the Death Star. Description: This series of walks tells the story of the Port of London through four guided walks. Led by Footprints of London guide Rob Smith, each walk covers a different period in the development of the Port of London from the Romans to Canary Wharf Walks are at a moderate pace, with frequent stops, where we will look at some of the legacy of the Port of London ‚Äì street names, mooring posts, cranes, plaques etc. We will look at old maps and photographs as we walk, and there will be chance for questions and discussion. Each walk will last about two hours and cover 1.5-2 miles distance. The third walk from Royal Victoria Dock to Pontoon Dock looks at the vast Royal group of docks, built for steamships by entrepreneur engineers. The walk looks at some of the industry that was created by the docks. We will also talk about the dock workers strike of 1889 and the creation of the Port of London authority
Title: Walking Tour - London's Port History - Part 3 The Royal Docks
Subtitle: The 3rd of 4 walks telling the story of the port of London looks at the huge docks built for steamships in Victorian London

We're exciting to host a night market with ten female-led businesses selling everything you need to get Ramadan-ready! From luxury perfume to jewellery and traditional Sudanese clothing and gifts.  All proceeds from tickets will go towards supporting 4 Wings Global Project. About 4 Wings Global Project 4 Wings Global Project is a social enterprise on a mission to create safe, inclusive and compassionate spaces where people from different ethnicities can build social and cultural bridges. Proceeds from this event will go towards creating a cultural space and cafe to help refugees and asylm seekers in South London to integrate into their host community.

Description: Authentic Movement is a form of moving meditation based on the relationship between the mover and the witness. This one-day workshop introduces the concept of the inner witness, one of the basic elements of this practice. As you practice mindfulness in movement, you will learn how to track your inner-sensations, spontaneous movement expression and moments of stillness whilst moving in the presence of a witness.¬† Who will teach the course? This course is an experiential course and will be taught by Brenda Naso, Lecturer and Clinical Supervisor on the MA Dance Movement Psychotherapy, STaCS Department What are the learning outcomes? At the end of this course, participants will: ¬†
Title: Introduction to Authentic Movement - Developing your Inner Witness
Subtitle: Authentic Movement is a form of moving meditation based on the relationship between the mover and the witness.
