Description: The Ionian Singers with their conductor Timothy Salter are joined by the cellist Leo Melvin in a programme that journeys far afield in time and location: English madrigals from the early 17th century, little-known choral music from 19th century Russia ‚Äì Anton Arensky (three pieces for cello and chorus) and C√©sar Cui ‚Äì 19th and 20th century music from England ‚Äì including Stanford, Parry and Holst (in the 150th anniversary year of his birth) ‚Äì and English folk song arrangements. Music for solo cello by Gy√∂rgy Ligeti and Timothy Salter completes the programme.  The concert will be held in St Giles' Church, Camberwell on Saturday 9th March at 7.30pm.   The Ionian Singers is a chamber choir of about 25 singers, based in London, with a national and international reputation based on their performances and recordings. The programming and recording policy of The Ionian Singers is to search out less familiar and unjustifiably neglected repertoire both sacred and secular from the 16th century to the present. Concert programmes frequently include collaboration with instrumentalists and solo singers. The choir is known for its commitment to new music, has given many first performances and has commissioned and recorded new works from numerous British composers. www.ioniansingers.co.uk Cellist Leo Melvin graduated with honours from the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, where he studied with Richard Lester. Leo has performed several Concerti with orchestras such as Sinfonia D‚ÄôAmici, Kings Sinfonietta and Outcry Ensemble, and has recorded a solo cello track for Howard Goodall‚Äôs CD release ‚ÄòEnchanted Voices.‚Äô Leo lived in Germany for two years, studying with Kleif Carnarius, Claudio Bohorquez and Troels Svane. He has since been playing with LSO, LPO and Philharmonia orchestras in London, giving solo and chamber recitals, and teaching. Leo joined the Villiers Quartet in 2021. Timothy Salter is active as a composer, conductor and pianist. His compositions include instrumental, chamber, and orchestral music, choral music and songs; many of his choral compositions have been written for The Ionian Singers. He has received numerous publicly and privately funded commissions; his music has been recorded on various labels and broadcast throughout the world. For many years he taught composition and performance studies at the Royal College of Music, London. As a pianist, he performs widely with instrumentalists and singers.  www.timothysalter.com
Title: Concert with The Ionian Singers
Subtitle: The Ionian Singers and Timothy Salter are joined by cellist Leo Melvin in a concert at St Giles' Church Camberwell on Saturday 9th March

Description: Catch Amena live at Rich Mix, where she'll bring her latest project to the stage. Drawing inspiration from early Egyptian Folk music legends like Sheikh Imam and Sayed Darwish, she puts her unique twist on their timeless compositions. Amena is a talented singer and songwriter from Cairo, Egypt. Growing up in the vibrant city, she developed a love for both Arabic and Jazz music. Now, as she studies Jazz singing at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, she aims to bring together the best of both worlds.  Her goal is to create music that blends her cultural roots with the harmony and rhythms of Jazz, creating a captivating sound that speaks to people from all walks of life. In her newest project, she‚Äôs drawing inspiration from pioneers of early Egyptian Folk music like Sheikh Imam and Sayed Darwish. She's set to infuse their timeless compositions with her own unique twist. AWAN Festival is produced by Arts Canteen and supported by Arts Council England, Bagri Foundation and Cockayne foundation.

Subtitle: Amena blends her cultural roots with the soulful vibes of Jazz, creating music that connects with people from all walks of life.

Description: Behind that Door - Unlocking the history of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon This special exhibition explores the rich history of the Wimbledon Village Club and Lecture Hall building from its Victorian origins, intended to entice locals away from the pub towards more intellectual pursuits. Over the years the building has witnessed a full spectrum of experiences, providing piety and sobriety, shelter and camaraderie, conviviality and revelry. Discover the captivating stories of those who have lived, learned, taken refuge, created and drunk within its walls! Join us for this fascinating in-person event at the Wimbledon Museum. Open every Friday, Saturday and Sunday from 2:30 to 5pm, from 2nd February to 24th March. Access: Please note the museum is on the 1st floor, up a flight of stairs.
Title: Behind that Door - Unlocking the history of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon
Subtitle: Explore the captivating past of 22 Ridgway, Wimbledon founded as a Victorian endeavour to lure people away from the pub. 2 Feb to 24 March.

Description: Join us for a wonderful day of textile art with expert weaver Hilary Charlesworth. In this full day course,  Hilary will teach you all the skills necessary to produce your own woven designs. Using a simple frame loom and a variety of yarns, you‚Äôll spend the day learning how to weave a sampler of techniques, both traditional and 3D. All materials, including loom and yarns, are included, so you‚Äôll be able to continue practising at home on your loom. The workshop is suitable for both beginners and those with some prior experience of tapestry weaving. You'll be able to work on a sampler of techniques or, if you've attended a class before, why not create your own design? We‚Äôll provide lots of tea, coffee and cake throughout the day and there will be a break for lunch, when you can either eat a packed lunch or treat yourself at one of the many cafes in Teddington. Hilary is a very experienced teacher who‚Äôs been spinning and weaving for almost 30 years and has been featured on Kirsty Alsopp‚Äôs ‚ÄúHomemade House‚Äù. ‚Äúwonderful day. Hilary is a great teacher ‚Äì patient, clear expectations and lots of humour‚Äù ‚Äúsuper class ‚Äì great range of techniques and very absorbing‚Äù

Description: About this event: Welcome to our first London Playback Jam of 2024! What & why? The jam is a chance for the Playback community in and around London (and further afield if you are happy to travel in!) to connect and play together. We intend to have 3 jams over the year. Future jams may include workshops if jammers want to share specific skills. Who? This is being co-organised by members of Trueheart Theatre and London Playback (Andy Yau, Ferran Luengo, Bel Sherlock, Simon Floodgate) and is open to anyone who has completed their Core Training (or equivalent) or who has been part of a playback company for at least 6 months. How much does it cost? We need to cover the cost of the jam venue, and so are requesting ¬£8 contribution from each attendee. If we raise excess funds this time, those will go towards the costs of the next jam. What else do I need to know? Water bottles are allowed in the studio, but no other food or drink. So please come fed, and any snacks/drinks during the break will need to be consumed outside of the studio. For those who are able to, we can head to the local pub at 5pm for further socialising. Agenda: 2pm Arrive and set up 2:10 Check-in and warm-ups 2:40 Playback 3:20 Break 3:40 Playback 4:30 Wind down and check-out 4:50 Pack up and leave 5pm Post jam social for anyone who can make it
Title: Playback Theatre Jam
Subtitle: Let's do playback theatre together! :)

WHAT ARE THESE MONTHLY DATING MIXERS ALL ABOUT AND WHO ARE THEY FOR? Meeting people and making authentic connections can feel like an uphill challenge nowadays which is why these Monthly Singles Dating Mixers have been introduced ...to give singles aged 35+, the opportunity to meet in an intentional and exciting way. These mixers are a bit different as they: WHAT IS HAPPENING AT THIS MONTH'S SINGLES DATING MIXER : At this month's mixer we are getting together in a pub in Carshalton(South London) for drinks and/or something to eat, chat and enjoy some live music! It doesn't matter if you like to drink or are teetotal, alcoholic and non -alcoholic drinks are available at the venue. The live music is free. THE BENEFITS OF ATTENDING: If you are a single adult man or woman, 35+ after intelligent, authentic potential romantic partner or you would just love to have an evening of intelligent chat with perhaps a deep connection with someone of the opposite or same sex, whether for dating/romance or just friendship, then RSVP and come along! This is an opportunity for you to get out with a friend of the opposite sex that is also single and meet others in the same situation. Enjoy drinks and/or something to eat while listening to live music and having a chat and hopefully make new friends....and who knows you might meet that someone special! But even if that is not the case it will be a good few hours of pressure-free fun! WELCOME TO CONNECTED EXCLUSIVE EVENTS.... My name is Lou and it gives me great pleasure to offer events that connects people in meaningful and fun ways, while at the same time offering a more bespoke service that does not break the bank! Description: In a time marked by urgency, scarcity, resilience, and hope, AWAN Festival , in collaboration with Architects for Gaza, will bring together architects and environmentalists to narrate Gaza.  Participants will showcase innovative approaches to challenge the colonial erasure of the city and provide an alternative expression in architecture that can capture and revive the identity and memory of this coastal city.  While the talks aim to reconstruct the reality of the besieged, fractured Gazan landscape, Arab women architects employ architecture, drawings, and visual media as tools to narrate, heal, and reinterpret the city.  With a foot on the earth and a hand in the sky, the work attempts to reclaim the right to the city and asserts Gazan's right to reclaim their homes.  Speakers include:  The panel talk will be followed by a discussion moderated by Samir Pandya and Dr Nasser Golzari from the University of Westminster--
Title: Gaza Reborn -  A Foot on Earth, a Hand in the Sky
Subtitle: showcasing innovative approaches to challenge the colonial erasure of the Gaza city and offer an alternative expression in architecture.

Description: 2024 marks the year of the Wood Dragon in Chinese astrology. This is a year marked by dynamism, progress, growth, and positive change fueled by action and optimism. The Wood element encourages new ideas and ventures, and the Dragon thrives in groups, fostering teamwork and collaborations. Join us as we commemorate this potent year and seed our collective dreams into reality under the auspices of the New Moon in Pisces. About ƒÄKƒÄ≈öA ƒÄKƒÄ≈öA is a vibrant interdisciplinary community where exploration meets expansion. We curate enriching experiences at the crossroads of art, myth, nature, philosophy, and mindful practices. Fueled by the belief that our shared humanity holds profound potential, we yearn to cultivate connection, create healing spaces, and foster open dialogue. We long to remember the profound gift of connection that can never be fully experienced in isolation. Our experienced guides, drawing from ancient wisdom and modern practices like breathwork and yoga, support you in exploring your inner landscapes. By uncovering the wonder, joy, and deep connection within, we can co-create a more peaceful and loving world, together. Join us and embark on a journey to ‚ÄúWorlds beyond Words‚Äù. https://www.akasa.land ƒÄKƒÄ≈öA founders Lina and Maximilian are seasoned practitioners with 19 years of experience shared between them. Maximilian's passion for holistic healing began early, nurtured by his parents' involvement in the medical field. Eighteen months spent traversing Australia and Southeast Asia exposed him to diverse healing modalities, igniting a passion for holistic well-being. Upon returning to the UK, he embarked on a formal journey, acquiring expertise in Yoga, Personal Training, and Thai Yoga Massage. Maximilian's practice extends beyond these initial disciplines, seamlessly integrating Qi Gong, Breathwork, and Daoist Alchemical practices into his intuitive bodywork. This holistic approach fosters profound healing and transformation, tailored to each individual's unique needs. Beyond the physical realm, Maximilian is also a music producer. He bridges the digital and natural worlds, weaving together the power of synthesis with the organic beauty of live instruments and the human voice. These creations transcend mere music, evolving into healing soundscapes that resonate deeply with the body and soul. Descended from a lineage of healers, Lina carries a deep legacy of holistic well-being and root cause medicine. Her journey has led her to explore a tapestry of modalities, including naturopathy, functional and transformational breathwork, Daoist and Tantric alchemical practices, feminine embodiment, cranio-sacral therapy, shamanic healing, sound and voice activation, human design, and evolutionary astrology. This multifaceted approach allows her to understand the healing process from diverse perspectives, crafting bespoke pathways for individual transformation. Lina's approach blends ancient wisdom with the latest advancements in trauma-informed care and an embodied understanding of polyvagal theory. This ensures a holistic understanding of the nervous system's role in healing, creating a foundation for lasting transformation. With over a decade of personal exploration and experience, Lina guides individuals and groups on their healing journeys with unwavering support and deep compassion. She recognises the unique nature of each path and meets clients wherever they are, fostering a safe and empowering space for transformation. Tiamat is an ordained Priestess of the Dragon Rose Lineage, a Source channel and somatic therapist. She is in service to birthing the wisdom and beauty of the primal feminine across all of her work. She is a life coach and offers 1:1 mentorship.  In ceremony and workshops she transmits her essence through tantric embodiment practices, guided meditation, dance and joy.  She is here to awaken more love and unite more hearts through embodying the courage and grace of her dragon lineage. https://www.tiamatrose.com Instagram: @tiamat_rose
Title: ENTER THE DRAGON: A ceremonial opening to the year of the Wood Dragon
Subtitle:
Join us and those who are ready to co-create primordial magic for an evening of 
dancing, journeying and celebration...

Description: Come and celebrate International Women's Day with us for a revitalising and inspiring Kundalini Yoga & Meditation workshop at Globe House Yoga in London, UK. This event will take place at Crucifix Lane, a serene location perfect for connecting with your inner self. In this workshop, we celebrate women by diving deep into the power of their intuition as we meditate and connect with our third eye. The Third Eye, or Ajna in Sankrit is a chakra located in the middle of the forehead between the eyebrows. It's associated with intuition, insight and it can take us to a place of higher consciousness and clarity. What to expect? Marianne, our instructor, will start the session by guiding you into a state of relaxation by activating the prana in order to free the mind and body, preparing them for union, harmony and balance. You will then move to a gentle yoga flow focusing on third eye activations via the asanas. We will focus on somatic movements to replenish your energy before transitioning into shavasana for a guided yoga Nidra (meditation). After that, we will gather in a circle for a guided meditation by chanting, singing and repeating affirmations together to activate the third eye chakra. We will then conclude the session by enjoying a cup of Goddess Eyes‚Äô tea, a special homemade third-eye chakra blend made by Marianne. PLEASE ARRIVE 10 MINS BEFORE TO SETTLE IN FOR A PROMPT 2.30 PM START. Yoga mats and blankets will be provided at the venue. Please bring an Eye mask and a small pillow for comfort, if needed. The workshop is accessible to everyone with no yoga experience required. However, if you have any injuries or health issues, please email us at info@freesoulstribe. There are various entrances In GlobeHouseYoga. Please check the indications below https://www.globehouse.org/location.php Please be aware that pictures will be taken during the workshop and shared on our social channels. Don't miss this opportunity to nourish your mind, body, and soul. Join us for an unforgettable journey of self-discovery and inner growth. Reserve your spot today! About Marianne: Marianne is a Kundalini Yoga Teacher and Yoga Therapist. Currently on the path to becoming a Naturopathic Doctor and Master Herbalist, Marianne combines her yoga expertise with a passion for plant allies creating a holistic path to healing and wellness.
Title: Third Eye Chakra -  Kundalini Yoga & Meditation
Subtitle: Get ready for an afternoon of kundalini yoga and meditation to elevate your intuition and reconnect with your inner self.

Description: Join us for the Upcycling Jewellery Making Workshop! Looking for a creative and eco-friendly way to express yourself? Look no further! We invite you to join our in-person workshop every Thursday, held in our cosy studio at the vibrant Two More Years venue. In this workshop, you'll learn the art of upcycling, where you'll transform everyday objects into unique and stylish jewellery pieces. Our experienced instructors will guide you through the process, teaching you techniques to repurpose materials like bottle caps, old keys, fabric scraps, and more. Discover how to turn ordinary objects into extraordinary accessories that reflect your personal style. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced crafter, this workshop is open to all skill levels. Not only will you create stunning jewellery, but you'll also contribute to reducing waste and promoting sustainability. It's a win-win! Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to unleash your creativity and make a positive impact. Spaces are limited, so reserve your spot today!
Title: Upcycling  Jewellery Making Workshop
Subtitle: Join us for a fun and creative Upcycling Jewellery Making Workshop where you'll learn to transform everyday items into stunning accessories!

Description: After an Amapiano-full launch event, we go again for round 2 üî• Hosted by City Splash, aka THE HOME OF CULTURE, this is a new African dance music party that‚Äôll have you pulling out Shazam whilst you‚Äôre in the dance. Created to unite, connect, and celebrate the thriving African music scene in London üñ§ we‚Äôre bringing you the African HEAT with the hottest DJ‚Äôs! Expect all the best in Amapiano, Afrobeats, and Afro-dance: LINE UP: üéß Larrizle has made an impressive mark as a DJ over the past 15 years, fusing his love for the sounds of Amapiano, Tribal House and UK Funky. Having performed alongside the likes of Nas, Damian Marley, Burna Boy, Wizkid, Tiwa Savage, French Montana and Mark Ronson, his work takes him all over the world - but all roads lead to The Hackney Social on the 9th March! üéß Golden Lady is a South African born DJ making waves in England. Her love for SA house music and culture is perfectly complimented by Golden Lady‚Äôs unique flare of deep soulful melodies! She has worked with the likes of Ralf Gum, Afro Brothers, Prince Kaybee, Madoraisindahouselecroque, and Vigro Deep to name a few. üéß Harriet Bella excellently fuses timeless classics with fresh sounds from underground artists, drawing from Amapiano, Afro House, Deep House, and more. Having graced the decks at Soho House, Tape London, and numerous events, Harriet Bella is quickly emerging as a hidden gem in the scene. üéß J GADGET specialises in Amapiano, Gqom, Afrotech, and more, seamlessly blending traditional influences with contemporary beats. He has shared the stage with Uncle Waffles and continues to embody African electronic dance music whether at the decks or owning the dance floor! Set to be another night filled with sensational music, community & culture, don‚Äôt miss out on this one! üéâ
Title: City Splash presents: Abundance
Subtitle: Created to unite, connect, and celebrate the thriving African music scene in London, join Larizzle, Golden Lady, Harriet Bella + J GADGET!

Description: Hi Welcome to a casual wine tasting trying 5 different wines with a specific theme - Wines from Marche region (Central Italy). This region produces some great wine and when we voted for our favorite wine at the end of the sessions, many times wines from Marche won. We also have an article about the region with a map located here. There will also be a few smaller dishes served halfway through the tasting. Please expect 2-2,5h in total and please arrive in time as we will taste all wine together. We will cap the attendance to 10 with 8 available seats for prepurchase. Only prepurchase online sales. The main host has WSET Level 2 and 3 with distinction but please do not expect a masterclass but rather hopefully a less formal tasting where everyone is welcome no matter your knowledge. Please also be aware that this event is held in a private apartment. Details on how to attend will be sent to the registered email. The images below are from previous tastings in different locations throughout the years. It would be great to get the wine tastings back on a regular basis so hope to see you on Saturday! Images are from previous event hosted in Kings Cross, London as well as Madrid, Spain.
Title: Social Wine Tasting - Theme: Wines from Marche (Central Italy)
Subtitle: Welcome to a casual blind wine tasting with wines from Central Italy.  Light snacks provided. 10 seats only.

Description: Experience the profound benefits of sound healing in a small group setting. Join us for these rejuvenating meditation and sound bath sessions designed to balance and harmonise the body and mind and leave you feeling completely relaxed. Allow the gentle sounds of the gong, Tibetan bowls and crystal bowls to wash away any stress, tension or negativity after a busy week and start the weekend feeling refreshed and recharged. Please note that sound healing is not recommended for women in their first trimester of pregnancy, people with a pacemaker or other heart rate abnormalities, or people with sound-induced epilepsy.
Title: Sound Healing Journey: Discover Inner Harmony And Deep Relaxation
Subtitle: Experience the transformative power of sound as soothing vibrations wash over you, melting away stress and restoring inner balance.

Description: Why not join us on a late winter Saturday afternoon and unleash your imagination in our latest creative writing session? Do you have an interest in writing and don‚Äôt know where to begin? Look no further. This writing workshop with local teacher and writer Janette Simpson will provide you with a variety of fun writing exercises to get you going. You will learn that it is all about the journey, not the destination. The class is suitable for all, whether a novice or an experienced writer. Lots of tea, coffee and homemade cake are included to help creativity! Janette Simpson is an experienced and popular writing teacher, who has led many creative writing workshops with both adults and children. Participant numbers are kept deliberately low (maximum 8) to ensure that everyone has plenty of opportunities to contribute and to ask questions. "Janette was really enthusiastic and supportive." "The class was fun and I enjoyed the various different tasks."
Title: Creative Writing For Beginners
Subtitle: A wonderful introduction to creative writing and inspiration to start you on your writing journey

It will be 100% audience vote so bring as many people as you can to support you! Free entry. All we ask is to get yourself a drink and enjoy the night! However you can chose to make a donation if you would like to support this event. üòä We have a Professional Sound and Lighting System üîâ(Including monitors) üï∫üèæüï∫üèæDJ SET UNTIL 1AM!!üï∫üèæüï∫üèæ T&C: By participating in this competition, you agree to the following terms and conditions: * Voting: * The competition's outcome is determined by audience votes. * Winners and finalists will be announced at the conclusion of each event. * Each person in the audience is entitled to vote for two artists. * Prizes: * The money prize will be awarded to the winner and will be transferred via bank transfer. * The bank transfer will be initiated no later than 14 days after the conclusion of the event. * In addition to the monetary prize, the winner will receive two hours of studio time to record their music. * Competition Structure: * This competition consists of two rounds. * Participants who win one of our weekly events will have the opportunity to take part in the final round. Nearest Tube Station: Shoreditch High Street See you there!! This event is hosted by Rick (@rick.six6)

Description: [something‚Äôs happening] https://somethingshappening.bandcamp.com/album/something-like-that [something‚Äôs happening] is the sound and text duo of poet and performer Iris Colomb and composer Daryl Worthington (Beachers). The project explores textual and sonic permutation through improvisation. Fragments of found text and gestural electro-acoustics weave through spectral guitar textures. Loops of sound and language collide. Stj√∫pytt Radio Orchestra https://stjupyttradioorchestra.bandcamp.com/album/tilifeel Stj√∫pytt Radio Orchestra create dense sonic landscapes, terraforming sounds through radiowaves and analogue collision. Words, rhymes and voice weaves itself between the sludge. hi! capybaras https://hicapybaras.bandcamp.com/album/a-m-y-g-d-a-l-a-ep joe chill aka william posters aka edi twoohnine akavinnie knids aka betty bottomdollar aka hi! capybaras uses spoken word and music to explore the concept of eternalism and simultaneous time, in a block universe duo with the past form of leonard susskind as he was in stamford massachusetts in 2007. their A/M/Y/G/D/A/L/A E/P was entirely improvised and recorded in single takes, using minimal phone notes and stream of consciousness to write the candid, confused and sometimes painfully honest text, by the open window of peach studios in dalston over the new year of 2023-24. now, joined by their pet snail gary, joe chill aka william posters aka edi twoohnine akavinnie knids aka betty bottomdollar aka hi! capybaras will perform the three tracks from the ep and a new unreleased song entitled "clean as a whistle mate, clean as a whistle" - with their long time (and completely unaware) collaborator professor leonard susskind having prepared and recorded his part over 15 years ago. is time really a linear process, are the ones we love truly gone? what if all moments are coinciding endlessly? what if we can go back? what would leonard do?
Title: [something's happening] / Stj√∫pytt Radio Orchestra / Hi! Capybaras
Subtitle: A night where words go into sounds and sounds go into words

Description: üåü Sparkle Alert! üåü üéâ Ready for an unforgettable Saturday night? 'That‚Äôs Drag' Bingo isn't just a game, it‚Äôs an adventure in Brixton filled with laughs, glamour, and a dash of sass! üéâ Picture this: The fabulous trio ‚Äì Orange Gina, Ariel Bold, and Magik (with a ‚Äòk‚Äô) ‚Äì are ready to host a bingo night like no other. Imagine a room sparkling with laughter, a bingo machine that's more firecracker than appliance, and a vibe so electric it could light up the London Eye! üî• But wait, there‚Äôs more than just bingo! Indulge in the tastiest street food Brixton has to offer - a perfect fuel for our bingo champions. üçîüåÆ Now, let‚Äôs make your experience as smooth as a bingo ball: üïï Early Birds Get the Fun: Swing by early to soak up the atmosphere! Doors open at 6:00 PM, giving you ample time to enjoy our delicious food and drinks. The show kicks off at 7:30 PM, so don't be fashionably late! üß• Cloakroom Chronicles: Remember, no bags or coats in the live room - our cloakroom's got you covered! Stow away your belongings and step into the fun, hassle-free. ü™ë Seating Shenanigans: It's all about getting cosy! Our event is seated, with tables arranged in friendly rows. Embrace the chance to make new friends - you might find yourself sitting next to a soon-to-be bingo buddy! üé≠ A Dash of Daring: Our show is a rollercoaster of interactive fun, complete with strong language and adult themes - all in the name of comedy! While our performers might chat with you for a laugh, rest assured, it's all verbal and all in good spirit - no physical interaction required or allowed. So, mark your calendars, bring your lucky charms, and get ready for a night of dazzle, laughter, and unforgettable memories at 'That‚Äôs Drag' Bingo. It's more than a game; it's a night of unbridled joy and entertainment! üí´üëë üåü We can't wait to see you at 'That's Drag Bingo Show'! üåü Your ticket unlocks more than just an evening of fabulous bingo ‚Äì it's also your exclusive pass to the club night happening right after the show! Keep the party going and dance the night away in the vibrant atmosphere of Brixton. Please remember, this glittering event is for the 18+ crowd only. Bring your ID for a smooth entry. Tickets are unique to you - they're non-transferable and non-refundable. And remember, our friendly but firm R.O.A.R. policy means re-entry is at our discretion. Got questions or need assistance with your booking? Our team is here to help! Just drop us an email at bookings@brixtonjamm.org and we'll make sure your experience is as seamless as your dance moves. üíÉ‚ú®

Description: "Sacred womban re-awaken, sacred womban in the making" Sister the time has come for you to unfurl in the Sacred womb circle: After much hiatus, @nurturing.me are returning to the powerful invocation of soft sister circles, but we have evolved. Expect a medicine-infused circle with sound, movement, and breathwork, and affirmation. THE SACRED WOMBAN CIRCLE: This will be a Womb yoga dance-focused event, interwoven with Kundalini Yoga. Come prepared, but know that the container is sacred, and you will be held throughout the journey. Like the Elder tree, you will be guided along a journey to shed, and re-birth anew. "Elder trees were associated with rebirth and transformation. In some folklore, it was believed that if an elder tree was cut down, a new one would grow in its place, symbolizing the cycle of life and regeneration" On the day that we turn to honour and revere the Divine Mother, we will commune in circle. Expect a 3 hour guided journey with breathwork, kundalini Kriya, and a Womb Yoga dance practice. On this New moon lunation we will honour that mother within us, that mothers that have held, carried, and nurtured us, and the mothers that we are becoming. Mothering is a constant process WHAT TO BRING: You soft, centered and focused self, a bottle of water to integrate, an item that represents/reflects the Divine Mother You will be provided with a skirt/sarong for the duration of the event. Please note, that the event will be filmed. Blessed Love, Layah and Isabella Come adorned in white, for white is the colour of purification and protection. We look forward to having you beloved Collectively, we are softening üêö #kundalini #Kundalini Yoga #Holisticmothersday #Wombyogadance #Sacredwoman #womban #wombwisdom #divinemother #meditiation #sacredbreathwork
Title: The Sacred womban circle
Subtitle: activate and awaken the sacred womban , the medicine womb an that is waiting to be re-birthed...

Description: Your opportunity to get cosy, snuggle under a blanket and do nothing except completely relax. With gentle focus on your breathing I will help you press pause on your busy mind, worries, and fears - whilst encouraging you to become fully present in the space. As you settle, you will begin to lose any tension within, as I guide you through a journey of sounds , where healing vibrations, frequencies and sensations will weave their magic over and through you. My intention is to create a safe and sacred space , helping you to melt into peace and retrieve exactly what you need. To do this I use a selection of ALCHEMY crystal bowls and other soothing instruments for each unique journey. The best way to describe this form of meditation is science with a splash of magic and one which is best understood in the moment of the experience. WHERE ARE WE. Nestled behind the cafes and shops within the Crystal Palace Triangle you will find us tucked away from the hustle and bustle. Just opposite Sainsburys, you will find the BlackBird Cafe and the Venezulan Cafe. In between is a small alleyway which you will walk down and come to a little mews. Walk to the end of the mews and you will find The Little escape Studio on your left. It's situated between the pilates studio and our sister treatment space. WHAT TO BRING: Due to the vibrational energies within these sessions its not recommended to attend a sound bath/soundjourney for anyone with epilepsy, pacemakers/metalplates, clinically diagnosed severe mental health disorders or those in a first trimester of pregnancy. Please do seek medical advice if you wish to attend and have any of the health concerns above. Please note tickets are non refundable but can be transfered to another person. Any questions or further information needed please do contact me via eventbrite message or email me @ zoemyogaandsound@gmail.com. You can also contact me via DM on instagram @zoem_yogaandsound.

Description: 60 mins Power Yoga & 15 mins Reiki Meditation - Starts 16:15pm Join us for an invigorating and relaxing session of power yoga and reiki meditation! This in-person event will be held at the Light Centre, Marylebone High Street, London, UK. During the 60-minute power yoga session, you'll get your heart pumping and muscles working with dynamic poses and flowing movements. It's a great way to build strength, flexibility, and improve your overall fitness. After the power yoga session, we'll transition into a 15-minute reiki meditation. Reiki is a gentle healing technique that promotes relaxation and balance. You'll experience deep relaxation and a sense of calm as the reiki energy flows through you. Whether you're a yoga enthusiast or new to both power yoga and reiki meditation, this event is suitable for all levels. Join us to recharge your body and mind, and leave feeling refreshed and rejuvenated!
Title: 60 mins Power Yoga & 15 mins Reiki Meditation
Subtitle: Get ready to sweat it out and find your inner peace with 60 minutes of power yoga followed by a reiki healing meditation - starts 16:15!

Description:
Go on 15 dates at our popular
 Saturday night Speed Dating
 event at our fun Circus themed bar
 Trapeze
 in the heart of trendy Shoreditch. This event is for ages 21-30 age guide and has an equal ratio of men and women.
 
 
 
 
 Expect to meet a lots of single professionals at the best Speed Dating event on Saturday night. Easily one of our most popular events with a great crowd every week.
 
 
 Speed Dating kicks off at 8pm prompt and any guests arriving late may not be able to take part so please ensure you arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time to allow for registration.
 
 
 When all the guests have arrived the host will explain how the evening will unfold and you will be provided with a scorecard and pen. When the event begins women will be seated and men will rotate between tables every 4 minutes. At the end of each date guests mark on their scorecard or phone using our mobile website whether they would like to see that person again.
 
 
 The event will finish around 9:30pm but guests are welcome to stay and mingle if they wish.
 
 
 The following day we'll contact you with the results and you can communicate with anyone you've matched with through our website.
 
 
 Please be aware that speed dating places are limited and the majority of our events do sell out, so please book early to avoid disappointment.
 
 
 If you have any queries about this event please contact us at enquiries@dateinadash.com or call our telephone bookings hotline on 0845 862 1448 9am 5pm.
Title: Speed Dating in Shoreditch (Ages 21-30)
Subtitle: Go Speed Dating on Saturday night in London at this fun circus themed bar in Shoreditch. Ages 21-30. 15 dates. Tickets ¬£20.

Description: Design Your Own Wedding Gown Workshop Join us for a fun and interactive workshop where you can unleash your creativity and design your dream wedding gown! Whether you're a bride-to-be or simply passionate about fashion, this event is perfect for you. Get ready to dive into the world of bridal fashion and create a gown that truly reflects your personal style. During this hands-on workshop, our experienced designers will guide you through the process of sketching, fabric selection, and embellishment choices. You'll learn about different silhouettes, necklines, and dress styles, allowing you to customise every detail to your liking. Whether you envision a classic ball gown, a sleek mermaid silhouette, or a bohemian-inspired creation, this workshop will help you bring your vision to life. Don't worry if you're not an expert in sewing or design ‚Äì this workshop is open to all skill levels. Our friendly instructors will be there to assist you every step of the way. At the end of the workshop, you'll leave with a personalised sketch of your dream gown and a newfound confidence in your design abilities. This is also a great opportunity to meet other brides-to-be and share your ideas and experiences. So, grab your friends or come solo, and let's embark on this exciting journey together! Spaces are limited, so be sure to reserve your spot today. We can't wait to see you at the Design Your Own Wedding Gown Workshop!Wait! There is more! You will automatically enter a prize draw for a bridal portrait session with hair styling and makeup service in Paris worth ¬£1200! The next prize draw date will be 1st March 2024.

Description: Wise Woman bring their heady collision of lush vocal harmonies, cinematic cello and 90s girl power to Jamboree as part of their UK tour, tonight celebrating International Women's Day! Theatrical DJ and queer music curator Auntie Maureen will also keep the dancefloor moving! Hailing from the East Anglian and Welsh wildlands, power-folk 4-piece formed in the darkness of a pandemic winter. Their ‚Äústartling and shimmering‚Äù (Folk Wales) songwriting, blending folk, jazz and musical theatre has has enchanted audiences far and wide. Their live show journeys through their acclaimed debut EP 'Thread' (2022) as well as innovative arrangements of traditional folk favourites. From fenland witches to Boudicca and the smoky underbelly of 1905 New Orleans, their intricate music transports audiences on a theatrical dream ride through forgotten worlds and everyday treasures. The band release their 'Home Safe' with a video starring dancer and The Place Associate Artist Anders Duckworth in April, 2024. Theatrical DJ and queer music curator, Auntie Maureen likes to dig deep, rendering audible the sonic stories of the invisible, the forgotten and the erased. Queering up DJ sets, she / they have swayed dancefloors at proud events including Kew Gardens' Queer Nature Lates,¬†Happy Valley Pride's 2023 rowdy Big Bingo Show hosted by Timberlina,¬†Tate Britain's Queer Britannia and more.
Title: Wise Woman: An International Women's Day Special Show at Jamboree
Subtitle: Wise Woman bring their heady collision of lush vocal harmonies, cinematic cello and 90s girl power to Jamboree as part of their UK tour, ton

Description: Join us for a quintessential British trek: Dover to Folkestone. Let the sea inspire your steps this Saturday. This is a highly scenic coastal walk with fine sea views throughout. It introduces you to some of the quainter sides of Folkestone, a town which, like many south coast seaside towns, is undergoing something of a renaissance.We climb up past two Martello Towers (Napoleonic-era fortifications) onto a high clifftop, following the North Downs Way. This path is easy to follow, has fine Channel views, and passes the Battle of Britain Memorial and then a fascinating series of World War II installations, including a rare sound mirror (an early form of aircraft detection that was superseded by radar), and some large gun emplacements. ### HOW TO FIND US Maria will be at the meeting point detailed in the section "Transport and Meeting Point" below. In case of difficulties locating her, you can call her on 07535295739 (texts cannot be replied to). ### FOOD We will stop during the hike for a snack lunch so please bring food and drink. We will visit a pub after the hike where we can get refreshments. ### COST The cost includes the guided hike, the transport, and liability insurance. ### PRICE: ### WHAT TO BRING ### SAFETY AND TERMS AND CONDITIONS Payments are non-refundable and non-transferable.By signing up for this event you agree to the Terms and Conditions ### SAFETY Notice: Photos and videos taken during our events are for personal use only. Commercial use is strictly prohibited without prior consent. Please respect the privacy and rights of all participants. For more details, visit our Photo and Video Usage Policy.This hike is led by a trained hike leader and qualified Outdoor Activity First Aider. Outdoor activities involve a risk of personal injury. Please come with suitable hiking footwear and hiking clothes such as warm clothes, waterproof jacket and trousers in case of rain - more info ### HOW TO FIND US Maria will be at the IFO (Bird Cage) in Battle Bridge Place, which is the detailed meeting point in the "Meeting Point" section below. It is important that you check in with Maria upon your arrival at the meeting point to confirm your attendance. In case of difficulties locating her, please call or send a message to Maria on 07535295739. ### MEETING POINT We'll meet at London King's Cross railway station, specifically at the IFO (Bird Cage) located in Battle Bridge Place, at 8:40am, and we'll leave the meeting point at 8:50am. We will return around 8pm. We have a group train ticket, so all attendees will go and return together to the same station. If you want to return separately, please buy your individual train ticket. Link to Google Maps
Title: DOVER TO FOLKESTONE DAY HIKE SATURDAY 9 MARCH 2024
Subtitle: Join us on our new, exciting hike across Surrey's magnificent upland landscapes - designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

Description: Jazz Brunch Ninety One are excited to welcome you to our live Jazz Brunch experience. Join us in our intimate living room, just off the bustle of Brick Lane, to enjoy a delicious 2-course meal (with option to upgrade to 3 on the day), bottomless prosecco and live jazz. Take a seat and relax while listening to some of the finest Jazz musicians that London has to offer. Contemporary jazz pianist Bruno Heinen will take to the stage each week, inviting along a special guest to join him - from vocalists to saxophonists. Two sets of live jazz, from 1pm - 1:45pm and 2:15pm - 3pm.  Our in house chefs from the incredible Feed the Village have curated a plant-based menu that's full of flavour and seasonal ingredients, featuring dishes such as pan-fried gnocci, truffle mushroom tart & sticky toffee pudding. To view the full menu, please visit: https://91livingroom.com/jazz-brunch/ Tables are booked from 12.30pm till 4pm with the live music starting at 1pm. You can add our bottomless prosecco option or choose from our incredible cocktail menu to make a day of it. You can book tables of either 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8. If your party is of 6 or larger than 8, please book multiple tables and we will do our best to accomodate you. Upgrading to a 3-course meal will charge a ¬£6.50 supplement per person. Our bottomless option is an extra ¬£15 per person and this can be booked via DICE.
Title: Jazz Brunch
Subtitle: Intimate live jazz on Brick Lane, paired with a delicious 2 or 3 course meal and drinks.

Description: As Mothers we pour so much from our hearts, wombs and being that we can often feel depleted and undernourished. We can crave and long to be held, loved, seen and to just be in a safe environment. Some of us Mother's do not recieve the love we desire, desrve and need fro our Mother's for many reasons. Held is a ceremony where you will be held by the Great Goddess and Gaia, by myself and your sisters.  This 3 Plant Medicine Ceremony is for Mother's, Step Mother's & Grandmothers of any age. You are welcome to bring your child (boy or girl) age 12 (as long as you know they will be happy so you can relax) and up or your own Mother. Being Held and healing with your lineage creates a ripple affect out into your own family and world. It also heals the wombs of your matriarchal lineage, which is needed in the world now. By giving ourselves the time and space to be held, loved and seen by other women it allows us to reconsider what we need in our daily lives, helps set stronger bounderies, softens our heart, relaxes the mind. Listening to other women‚Äôs stories & wisdom supports our Earth walk, this is what our ancestors would have done in times gone by and by reclaiming these sacred spaces back we heal the feminine in all. The Offering Sharing Circle To be seen, heard and share your hearts truth. Oracle Cards Guidance from the Divine Gentle Yoga & Movement To help release stagnant energy and make space for joy and magic Peruvian Cacao To bring you out of the mind and into your heart, allowing her to bloom like a Rose. Cacao is known as Mama or Abuela Spirit and is medicine of the heart. Ceremonial Grade Cacao is a magical superfood and the most complex food on Earth as it contains 600-1200 separate chemical (mineral and nutrient) components. Cacao holds the highest concentration of antioxidants and magnesium of all foods. Rich in zinc, chromium, manganese, theobromine, serotonin, iron, copper, tryptophan, Omega 6 and Vitamin C. This power house of minerals and nutrients supports with mental health imbalances such as anxiety, depression, PTSD and is a natural energy enhancer. Cacao contains PEA, a chemical humans produce when we fall in love which is why feel so loved up with cacao and increases focus and alertness. Anandamide known as the bliss molecule can only be found in cacao! Peruvian Cacao - To bring you out of the mind and into your heart, allowing her to bloom like a Rose. Cacao is also proven to help you look younger! Spiritually Cacao will wrap her wings of love around you, supporting you with self-love, forgiveness, heart healing, grief, frustration, rebalances the body's energetic cells, releasing pain and stress, clear blockages from past traumas, connection to higher self. Takes you out of the mind and into the heart. The Ash√°ninka Tribe are an indigenous people of the Amazon rainforest comprising about 120,000 members, making them one of the largest indigenous Arawakan groups. Their origin is in Peru and their ethnicity has a historical relationship with the Inca Empire. Today, they are distributed mainly in Peru (188,000) and Brazil (2,000), covering a fragmented territory of about 100,000 km¬≤ in the past. (This information is from aquaverde.org) Peruvian Bobinsana Master Plant Teacher that opens the heart and gives the heart energy. Bobinsana helps somebody access ‚Äòblocked emotions and to let go‚Äô. Supports emotional growth. Can give you Strength and Flexibility. The bark is an anti-inflammatory and helps with arthritis, bone pain, cold and flu, oedema, fatigue, rheumatism, uterine cancer, uterine disorders (prolapse), and water retention. Traditionally used as a contraceptive in the Amazon. Cacao Flower Essence Cacao known as Mama or Abuela Spirit is medicine of the heart. The Cacao flower is what grows into a pod of cacao. The Flower medicinally is known for her nourishment and is good for when your feel depleted, weak, she helps us to thrive and create with ease. Shamanic Journey with Drumming & Sound A Guided Journey to be held and nourished by the Great Mother Goddess and Gaia. This includes, drumming and shamanic instruments. Journaling Time to reflect as a Mother on your needs in life and how they can be met. Feminine Art Practices/Honouring Ancient rituals/practices to honour us as Women and Mothers Soup and Treats We will end the day with Soup to feel nourished and feed before you float home. Personally, I could not think of anything more I would like to do then to be loved and cared for on Mother‚Äôs Day, putting myself care first. It's the perfect gift to self or for your Mother, Step Mother or Grandmother. This Offering comes from my heart, as a single Mother of 3 boys wishing I had these spaces or knew about them in order to walk my Earth Walk in more Love, Peace, Harmony, Joy, Bounderies, Patience & Peace. But also seeing in the women I support that this is what they need, too. Pease arrive 15 mins early and wait outside to be welcomed in. What to bring Water bottle Note book Anything to make you comfortable Something for the altar All of you, that is ready to be held and loved. If you are on any Medication please let me know so I can make sure you have the right dosage of Cacao.
Title: Held
Subtitle: A Plant Medicine Ceremony for Mothers,Step Mothers, Grandmothers, their Child/ren or Mother

Description: This will be a circle dedicated to the women and mothers of our lineages. We will specifically focus on healing these relationships for ourselves through family constellations and ritual. We'll work on inclusion, acknowledgement, release and unentanglement of what we might be holding for the women, what wounds we are still living for them and what gratitude we owe them for our lives.  Everyone will take something out of this day in acknowledgement and celebration of Mother's Day and International Women's Day. A circle of maximum 15 people, connected by intention to work with our issues, to attend to family dynamics and to gain a new perspective on the real roots of what we are dealing with right now. We will have time for five constellations. We have a short interview with each issue holder about the presenting question/situation and then ask participants in the circle to represent relevant elements/people of the family system, revealing the hidden patterns, dynamics and loyalties that might be driving the issue. We will also do an ancestral meditation for the whole circle. We will have breaks for tea and lunch. Here you can book a representative place. For issue holder places (to receive a constellation) see the link below. F or more information and to book an issue holder place please visit the website here https://www.asconstellations.co.uk/store/p18/family-constellations-london.html The venue is William Morris House - a beautiful building and a spacious room in an area with lots of coffee shops and restaurants. It is about 10 minutes walk from Wimbledon station. Once you register, you will receive an email with instructions and details of the venue. It is only 25 min from Waterloo station and 35 min from Victoria, with really good train, tube and bus connections. Systemic Family Constellations is a beautiful way to look at the real roots of some of the issues we face in life. It gives a different perspective and provides a new understanding of the dynamics that guide us in our decision making. It helps to reveal what is true for our relationships, and hopefully create shifts that would initiate healing and change. In a constellations circle we learn how to listen to our bodies through representing various family members, we learn to be in the present moment with what is and without any judgement or interpretation of what is happening. Systemic constellations are not to be used to replace any conventional medical or psychotherapeutic diagnosis or treatment. When you reserve your place you take full responsibility for your own mental and physical health before, during and after the workshop. Aleksandra Shymina or the venue will not be held responsible for your health and wellbeing. If you have any further questions about this work or would like to book an individual session, please contact Aleksandra at asconstellations@gmail.com
Title: Family Constellations Circle - Women of the Lineage
Subtitle: Full day workshop of five family constellations to look at hidden dynamics that are at the root of life challenges. Special focus on mothers

Description: Circling is a practice that allows us to slow down and explore this, to bring our attention to what happens in us when we relate with others. It invites us to make contact with all we are and to reveal this in our relating with each other. There is no goal or final destination and it‚Äôs partly this that allows us to experience deep states of connection and uncover long-forgotten parts of ourselves. Circling is often described as a relational meditation. It is built on numerous cutting-edge but simple techniques that support us in finding what is most true to us and communicating this powerfully and naturally. It widens our perspectives and our ability to receive and stay open to others. It nurtures a sense of deep personal and collective trust that is both relieving and generative. It gives us access to explore the golden palaces of our awareness. The workshop takes place in a cosy, clear geodesic dome on a rooftop in South East London, with a maximum of 12 participants. We will warm up with fundamental Circling exercises in 2s, 3s and 4s before coming together for group practices. These may include Birthday Circling, where the whole group gives their attention to one person for a period of time, Organic Circling, where we let our our attention move freely around the circle and Surrendered Leadership. No prior experience is necessary to take part. Teas and light snacks will be available and we will break for lunch. You are welcome to bring your own food or go out in the local area. Whilst this event suits those who have Circled before and newbies, the process can be emotionally rigorous. It is a daring practice that requires courage to meet what is within us, all that is within the other and to reveal this to each other. This workshop can be intense. People encounter places, states, emotions, beliefs, and sensations in themselves and others that are sometimes unfamiliar. We explore the unknown, the volatile, the ambiguous, as well as welcome emotions many deem as ‚Äúnegative‚Äù or ‚Äúinappropriate‚Äù such as feelings of inadequacy, anger, sexuality, and joy. We refer to the willingness to feel difficult and uncomfortable truths as the ‚Äúcommitment to connection,‚Äù which of course includes a willingness to set appropriate boundaries and speak a desire for space, distance, and non-contact. By attending our events you take responsibility for choosing to leave the practice or participate in any given moment‚Äîwhich might include getting intimate with these kinds of experiences. We will often explore multiple sides of seeming opposites at once, such as independence and interdependence, chaos and order, and agreement and disagreement. We believe this can reveal an underlying unity of the immediacy of experience. If the above description of our workshops sounds potentially overwhelming or destabilising for you, if you have a mental illness or significant emotional challenges that you feel may be exacerbated by this type of transformational environment, or if you are not sure that you can be self-directed in taking care of your needs during the event, then we advise you not to enrol. ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ There is a brilliance in my emotional state that does not lend itself well to words, but without a doubt circling is a practice that I would not only recommend but encourage everyone to try. Katja - Designer ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ We started as total strangers and ended having seen something breathtaking in each other. It was a gentle journey that took us somewhere quite profound. Rich W - Marketing Strategist ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I'm feeling really expansive and grounded in myself with a renewed sense of self respect. It's like my perception has been sharpened in a way that is exciting and hopeful. Sandra - Entrepreneur ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I have a wonderful sense of calm that I have rarely experienced in life. My body feels supple and relaxed, like it‚Äôs been washed through. I am finding a new ability to observe the world and everything looks slightly different to how I thought. Oli - Finance Professional ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ I learned things about myself that I didn't know before. Feelings and emotions that were hidden or masked. I now feel better connected with myself and can already see improvements in the way I connect with others. Nic B, CEO Adam founded Togetherness and has dedicated the past 15 years to exploring the fundamentals of meaningful human connection. He is a communication & boundaries coach, public speaker, curator and social entrepreneur. Adam has worked with more than 20,000 people in person and online. He is a trained counsellor, a certified wheel of consent and Circling facilitator, and a big advocate for playfulness and creativity. He regularly delivers creative and culture-changing workshops to businesses and organisations. More at AdamWilder.com Empowering cultural transformation, Togetherness are a social enterprise committed to imparting essential tools and facilitating experiences that create profound human connection. We do this through three programme offerings: Relational Intelligence through Circling, Boundaries, Limits & Desires with the Wheel of Consent and Authentic Leadership in the workplace. To find out more head to Togetherness.com.
Title: One Day Circling Immersion - Palaces of Awareness
Subtitle: A day of Circling, Relational Meditation and Collective Intelligence

Description: A walking tour around the picturesque neighbourhood of Bloomsbury. The area of Bloomsbury has, throughout history, been linked to London's culture, intellects, artists and writers. Today while exploring the picturesque neighbourhood, with its cosy public squares, you can stumble across numerous blue plaques and statues marking where notable women once lived, worked and died. This walking tour which starts at the Cambridge Theatre in Seven Dials will take you around Bloomsbury, walking in the footsteps of writer Virginia Woolf, World War Two Spy Noor Inayat Khan, abolitionist Mary Prince, Britain's first female dentist Lilian Lindsay and many more...!
Title: International Women‚Äôs Day - Women of Bloomsbury - Walking Tour
Subtitle: A 2.5 hour walking tour around the area of Bloomsbury  exploring the history of  women who left their mark on the picturesque area

Description: Our brand new Speed Dating event in Shoreditch takes place at the Lighthouse on Saturday night for ages 27-39 (age guide). At this event you can expect to meet around 15-20 people in 4-5 minute dates with an interval half way through for refreshments. Speed Dating kicks off at 8pm prompt and any guests arriving late may not be able to take part so please ensure you arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time to allow for registration. When all the guests have arrived the host will explain how the evening will unfold and you will be provided with a scorecard, name badge and pen. When the event begins women will be seated and men will rotate between tables every 4 minutes. At the end of each date guests mark on their scorecard whether they would like to see that person again. There will be a 15 minute break half way through to allow for refreshments. Once the event finishes guests will be able to stay in the venue for the club which provides the perfect setting for further conversation and socialising. Before you leave the host will collect all the scorecards in and collate the matches on our website and the following day you will receive an e-mail with the results. Please be aware that speed dating places are limited and the majority of our events do sell out, so please book early to avoid disappointment.

Description: Are you a QTIBPOC writer with a idea in mind? Or someone who has ideas but never had the chance to write them? Welcome to our club, where you will meet like minded people and move forward with your project with the guidance of award-wininng novelist and screenwriter Aude Konan. These writing sessions aim to create a space where you can tap into your creativity, try new ideas, find inspiration with unique and thought provoking writing prompts and get the advice you need to move further in your creative writing practice. It is open to all QTIBOPCs writers, regardless of experience or age.  About the facilitator: Aude Konan is an experienced workshop leader who based her work on prioritizing the voices of underrepresented voices from different communities. Accessibility: The Centre's accessibility statement is here. Covid and mpox safety at the London LGBTQ+ Community Centre: To keep our community safe, we ask that all visitors do not visit the Centre if they are feeling any Covid-19 and/or mpox symptoms including headache, fever, sore throat, consistent cough, chills and unusual spots, scabs or ulcers. You can wear a mask if you feel more comfortable. We also have masks and hand sanitiser available at the Centre. For current information on Covid and mpox please visit the NHS website.
Title: Writing Club for QTIBPOC
Subtitle: A new Writing Club for all Queer, Trans and Intersex Black and People of Colour

We advise you to visit the museum after you have had your drink as you will appreciate it more. 5/ Discounted ¬£5 / ¬£2.50 concessions admission available to all on Thursdays 6/ Locals living within walking distance with proof of address may buy ¬£6 tickets on the door 7/ Due to The Adult Nature of Some of the exhibits - Dead People / Erotica etc - under 18's are only allowed in when accompanied by a parent/guardian before 5pm 8/ Admission includes a free cup of tea on request 9/ Accessibility, unfortunately, due to the historic nature of the building,  access to the museum is via a narrow spiral staircase and there is no wheelchair access, If you have any questions regarding accessibility, please contact ali@absintheparlour.com. Last admission to the Museum is at 10pm. Online tickets are fully refundable up to 24 hours before, via eventbrite, we regret that they can not be changed or refunded after this
Organizer: The Last Tuesday Society & Viktor Wynd Museum
Title: Admission - Mar24 - Viktor Wynd Museum of Curiosities & UnNatural History
Subtitle: Admission Ticket  - come and see Fairies, Mermaids, Taxidermy, Dead People, Erotica, Magickal Items,  Artworks and more

Description: Like many ancient buildings, St John‚Äôs Gate and the Norman crypt have had a tumultuous past. These extraordinary medieval structures have survived against the odds because of the varied uses they have served over the centuries. Follow in the footsteps of knight-monks, printers, literati, publicans and philanthropists in a whistle-stop tour through 900 years of history. Learn about the characters who lived, worked and entertained here and how they adapted and re-imagined the buildings to meet their needs.  Tours will last 60 minutes. The tour includes the Priory Church, crypt and historic rooms in St John‚Äôs Gate.  For details of the accessibility of the site please see details at the link below, and contact the Museum to discuss your specific needs. https://museumstjohn.org.uk/planning-your-visit/access/
Organizer: Museum of the Order of St John
Title: TOUR Knights, Revellers & Saviours: The Many Lives of St John‚Äôs Gate
Subtitle: Follow in the footsteps of knight-monks, printers, literati, publicans & philanthropists in a whistle-stop tour through 900 years of history

Description: In these workshops hosted by the MEMBRANES exhibition at Hypha Studios Stratford, you will learn how to make a cast of your hand or another object provided using alginate and cast it using wax combined with other materials. This workshop expands on the doctoral research of Dr Jennifer Crouch, whose research explores MRI through art. Using body casting we will learn about what a 'medical phantom' is and create our own through body casting (casting hands in particular!). A medical phantom or simply ‚Äòphantom‚Äô is a specially designed object that is scanned or imaged in the field of medical imaging to evaluate, analyse, and tune the performance of various imaging devices. Jennifer made some of these as part of their research Using alginate to make moulds of hands and various other objects like fruit and paper-weights, you will have the chance to incorporate a variety of familiar plant-based materials that can be used as 'tissue-mimicking materials' (TMMs). Combining these TMMs in our wax moulds, you can create your own medical phantom. The workshop itself takes 1-3 hours depending on how detailed your phantom is. Bear in mind that the liquid wax will take about 30 minutes to cool and about an hour or so to solidify. Participants are welcome to collect their phantoms later during the MEMBRANES exhibition (open from the 1st of March until the 7th of April 2024).  Tea, coffee, fruit drinks, fruit and popcorn will be provided as light snacks. IMPORTANT HEALTH AND SAFETY NOTICE This is a safe workshop using safe food-safe materials which is open to people of all ages. We will use a temperature-controlled (50 degrees Celsius) device for melting wax which has been PAC-tested. For safety purposes, only workshop facilitators can use this equipment. Tools such as plastic tweezers will be available for adding plant matter to your phantoms. ¬† Practical explanation of the workshop
Title: MEMBRANES - 'phantoms making' body casting workshop
Subtitle: Join us in making simple wax casts of hands using alginate as part of the MEMBRANES exhibition at Hypha Studios

Description: MERRILY WE ROLL ALONG Music & lyrics by Stephen Sondheim Book by George Furth Based on the original play by George S. Kaufman & Moss Hart Director Julia Locascio Performed by BA (Hons) Acting Musical Theatre Designed & produced by BA (Hons) Theatre Practice Placement MA Movement: Directing & Teaching Mary, Charley and Frank are aspiring artists in New York. Frank is a composer, Charley, a lyricist and playwright, and Mary, a novelist then theatre critic. They stride into their careers ready to change theatre - and the world - for the better. But life has something else in store for them. Merrily We Roll Along is the culminating work of the Sondheim/Prince collaboration, a decade of hits including Company and Sweeney Todd. After its failed 1981 premiere, Merrily is now running again on Broadway to ecstatic reviews. This year's mainstage musical is a story told backwards, a dream in reverse, and a razor-sharp showcase for this year's graduating BA (Hons) Acting Musical Theatre artists. By arrangement with Music Theatre International www.mtishows.co.uk EMBASSY THEATRE, CENTRAL Monday 4 - Thursday 7 March, 7.30pm Friday 8 - Saturday 9 March, 2.30pm & 7.30pm
Organizer: Box Office, Royal Central School of Speech & Drama

Description: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibtion An act that introduces historicity and ruptures the archetypical presence, as perceived by the audience, entails an experience of violence and birth. Inspired by Siteng‚Äôs debut art pop EP, which features a violently nurturing subaquatic world, the immersive audiovisual experience, Violent Divinity, summons an underwater bloom of Asian artists. As artist/scenographer, JINGYI curated a biotically diverse wetland in a living home space. Encompassing photography, experimental films, performance arts, and interactive installations, the artworks highlight the power in acknowledging & transforming battle scars into art and thriving in a hostile environment. Siteng and JINGYI also ensure that the resonance will be further amplified by the Scene to create ripples through space and time. With a splashing multi-sensory opening performance, Violent Divinity will be followed by a five-day exhibition. The opportunity created to champion Asian artists will ripple far into the global art scene. The exhibition features works from 8 interdisciplinary artists of Asian origins: Siteng, JINGYI, Flo Yuting Zhu, Alya Kautsaranti, Julia D√®ng H√†nz√∫, Runxuan Yang, Aashfaria Anwar, and Luyin Cao. The exhibition is generously supported by Wired4Music, Youth Music, and LuckyPot. Contact sitenmusic@outlook.com and jingyi_studio@outlook.com for inquiries.
Title: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibition
Subtitle: An exhibition featuring 8 Asian Artists' eclectic works ‚Äì inspired by Siteng's debut art pop EP.

Description:
Join us for an unforgettable Saturday night at our popular Speed Dating event, located in the heart of trendy Shoreditch at our Circus-themed bar, Trapeze. This event is perfect for singles aged 21-35 (age guide) and offers an equal ratio of men and women.
 
 Expect to meet a diverse group of single professionals at one of the best Speed Dating events in town. With a fantastic crowd every week, this event is easily one of our most popular.
 
 The event commences promptly at 7pm, so please arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time to register. Latecomers may not be able to participate.
 
 Once all the guests have arrived, our host will explain the evening's format, and you will receive a scorecard and pen. The event begins with women seated, and men rotating between tables every 4 minutes. At the end of each date, guests indicate on their scorecard or via our mobile website whether they wish to see that person again.
 
 The event typically ends around 8:30 pm, but guests are welcome to stay and mingle if they wish. The following day, we'll notify you of your matches via our website, where you can communicate with anyone you've matched with. All our events sell out in advance so please book early to avoid disappointment. For any questions please drop us an e-mail to enquiries@dateinadash.com.

Description: Grab your 241 tickets for the hottest witch tour in town! Are you ready to learn historical facts? Are you ready to be thoroughly entertained? Join your characterful witch guide and hear the true historical tales of suspected London witches across the ages. Witness fascinating pieces of London history along the way too; hear secrets of Southwark Cathedral, The Golden Hinde, The Globe Theatre, Millennium Bridge and so very much more await on this character led walking tour. Starting by the infamous London Bridge your friendly costumed witch guide will lead you across Southwark's Southbank‚Äôs cobbles, seamlessly weaving history with vibrant storytelling. Widen your eyes to the tales of London‚Äôs real witches as you uncover the truth about the likes of Nicholas Culpepper ‚Äì people‚Äôs herbalist or bad boy herb doctor? Was Elizabeth Barton really that gifted? What about Jinny Bingham, did she deserve the nickname ‚ÄúMother Damnable"? And did Old Joan Butts get off Scot-Free? You make your own mind up on this magical educational journey to the past. You will wind your way down Winchester Walk, bob around the edges of Borough Market, clatter your way down Clink Street and buzz down Bankside. An intriguing Tudor ship and ruined Winchester Palace cannot be missed along the way. Your faithful guide will happily point out a certain Elizabethan dramatic playhouse as well as the breathtakingly iconic landmarks across the river including the majestic St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral of course‚Ä¶ In an experience that brings together true stories, history, and a wisdom that we can learn from our terrible ways of the past, you are sure to fall in love with this historic small part of the city and be enthralled by London‚Äôs witchy chronicles. You may even see some famous filming locations from Harry Potter along the way! Don‚Äôt miss the chance to join London‚Äôs wonderful Witches & History Magical Walking Tour and see things as you never have before‚Ä¶ *Please note this is an outdoor walking tour so dress for the weather, my dears.
Title: 2-4-1 London Witches & History Walking Tour
Subtitle: Experience London‚Äôs wicked history and see famous sights on this spellbindingly unique walking tour, led by a bewitching guide!

Description: Our Working Women of the East End tour will include the stories and locations important to Britain‚Äôs First Feminist; Mary Wollstonecraft, the East London Suffragette, Sylvia Pankhurst, Eleanor Marx, the Match strike of 1888. We will also discuss much more about what life was like for Women throughout the East Ends history. The walking tour starts at Tower Hill Station, Exit via the Ticket Hall, your professional tour guide will be waiting for you next to the Tram Refreshment cart. The East End has been an important area throughout London‚Äôs rich history. A place of refuge, change, idealism but also crime and poverty, its full of stories that draw in locals and tourists alike. In the streets, you can experience and learn about the people that call this area home, alternative culture, dynamic street art and much more. For decades people have visited the East End on walking tours that focus on crime, poverty and Jack the Ripper.¬† This walking tour aims to change the way the East End is seen, both by highlighting the Women involved in the areas vibrant history but also giving women, like those killed by Jack the Ripper a voice, by telling you their story.
Title: International Women‚Äôs Day - Working Women of the East End Walking Tour

Description: This is the invitation to the night of silence, of poetry and tea ceremony in Chadao tradition. Both Tea and Celtic Goddess Storytelling carry within them the powerful medicine that has the ability to heal, to transform, to empower. To connect us to ourselves and feel our own power, our own truth re-awakened.  Through sitting in silence with Tea from the wild growing trees we connect to our hearts, too Nature, to Mother Earth. We open up so we can listen. The storytelling that follows will bring us the medicine of powerful Welsh Goddesses - the goddess of Rivers, of Trees, of the Earth and so much more. There is no promise, and yet we know you will go away inspired and empowered and connected in a mysterious way. Please note that advance booking is necessary, as places are limited and fill up quickly. Last few Tea Ceremonies were SOLD OUT. Please note, NO REFUNDS are offered, however the booking might be moved to another date IF I am notified at least two days before the event takes place. Regardless of the reason, if I am notified after that time of your inability to attend, the booking is not going to be moved. The ticket, however, can be transferred to another woman.The seating is done on the floor. Comfortable clothing is recommended. After tea we will share some healthy snacks.I am looking forward to sharing a bowl of tea with you all! ABOUT KIM WILLIS Kim is a storyteller and spaceholder who is completing a two-year quest to rediscover the lost goddesses of Britain, as found in our oldest folklore. She has travelled around our islands exploring our wild mythology from manuscripts and through elders. She is part of the Chwedl network of Welsh women storytellers, and is dedicated to the aliveness and medicine in the British oral storytelling tradition, which dates back to pre-patriarchal, pre-Christian times. ABOUT LERA: Lera has been a devoted practitioner of the Leaf for many years. For centuries, Tea in the form of Chadao Practice has been used by Daoist Sages and Buddhist Monks for alchemy and transformation. Lera holds sacred spaces with the Medicine of Tea in Chadao tradition of Global Tea Hut, facilitating journeys from the head to the heart, to the intimacy of life itself. Tea as a sacred plant medicine creates this space for us to drop into the heart and just be. Her work also involves Vortex Energy Healing and Presence practices
Title: THE MYSTICAL EVENING OF TEA & CELTIC GODDESS STORYTELLING
Subtitle: This is the invitation to the night of silence, of poetry and tea ceremony in Chadao tradition.

Description: Date&Time TBA / Subject to change by Premier League. Please verify official page/google before booking. Tickets remain valid incase of change of fixture, no refunds. A matchday like no other Enrich your matchday beyond just the 90 minutes with our unrivalled Premium hospitality packages, offering a relaxed but first-class experience ‚Äì and, of course, the best seats in the house. Enjoy varied seasonal menus with the highest quality ingredients and mingle with legendary figures from Palace's history, whilst taking in every minute of Selhurst Park's iconic and world-famous atmosphere. Named in honour of our iconic Argentinian shot-stopper, this high-class restaurant emanates the warmth and charm which made Julian Speroni such a legendary figure at the club. Three-course dining is served alongside entertainment from club legends throughout the season ‚Äì the ideal supplement to experiencing that famous Selhurst Park roar from your seats in the Directors' Box. Description: Looking for a brilliantly unique walk through the capital‚Äôs vibrant Soho and West End? Then this brand new concept London Comedy Walk is the way to do it! This 2 hour tour is suitable for 12 years of age and older. Under 16s need to be accompanied by a responsible parent or guardian. The starting point is adjacent to Oxford Circus Tube Station Exit 8 (Argyll Street) and it finishes in Leicester Square. Guided by a expert in all things comedy, you‚Äôll be taken on a fun and laughter-filled journey through London's comedy history in all its glory. While exploring British comedy's many genres and performers, you'll see venues such as The London Palladium, The Hippodrome as well as modern-day comedy clubs such as The Soho Theatre.  Hear stories about, and jokes of, the many world-famous comedians that have performed here such as Stephen Fry, Ricky Gervais, Sue Perkins, Michael McIntyre and Sandi Toksvig. Also, hear about many comedy greats from other eras, such as Charlie Chaplin, Laurel and Hardy, Bob Hope, Joan Rivers, Kenneth Williams, Monty Python and Peter Cook & Dudley Moore. Whether it‚Äôs slapstick, satirical, alternative, stand up or dark comedy that you enjoy, there‚Äôs sure to be something on this great walking tour that tickles your funny bone.
Title: The London Comedy Walk
Subtitle: "Laugh and the world laughs with you", well that's what the The London Comedy Walk is all about, laughing, learning and being entertained.
