Description: Step inside the beautiful Blue Bear Bookshop, where we invite you to a fantasy land of Myths and Monsters. Authors Nikki Marmery, Nadia Attia and Sarah Underwood will be discussing their books Lilith and Verge, as well as their experiences as a writer and in the publishing industry. All myths retold as fiction, prepare to abandon reality and enter a magical world of Myths and Monsters. About Nikki Marmery - In a former life, Nikki worked as a financial journalist. She now writes fiction from a small village near Amersham, where she lives with her husband and three children. Her first novel, On Wilder Seas (2020), was shortlisted for the Historical Novel Society‚Äôs New Novel Award and selected for the Wilbur & Niso Smith Foundation‚Äôs #AdventureSociety book club. Her second novel, Lilith (2023), was picked as one of STYLIST‚Äôs Best New Feminist Retellings to Read in 2023. About Lilith - In the tradition of Madeline Miller and Claire North, Lilith is a story of the first woman, who was expelled from Paradise for disobedience. In this retelling of the Hebrew myth [NM1] that justified and explained woman's subjection to man, Lilith will have her revenge - however long it takes. In the Garden of Eden, at the beginning of time, an outrageous lie is born: that women are inferior. Inspired by ancient myths and suppressed scriptures, Lilith is a thought-provoking and ambitious novel with an evocative literary voice and a triumphantly engaging heroine. About Nadia Attia - Nadia Attia is a BFI Network Talent Executive and a published journalist. In 2019 she won the FAB (Faber) prize for fiction and was selected for the London Writers Awards. A graduate of the Curtis Brown novel-writing course, Nadia has been published in Spread the Word's City of Stories anthology, Star Songs and Luna Station Quarterly. Verge is her first novel. Follow her @nadia_land_ About Verge - The day Rowena Murray was born, 250 starlings fell like stones from the sky. Ever since, she has been marked by Death. First the visions; then her boyfriend died suddenly; now her father, too. Exploring belief, loyalty and legacies beyond our control, Nadia Attia's thrilling debut is as magnetic and unpredictable as the curse Rowena is racing to escape. About Sarah Underwood - Sarah Underwood grew up in Devon, England. A data scientist by training, she obtained her MEng in Computational Bioengineering at Imperial College, London and her MPhil in Population Health Sciences at the University of Cambridge. She now works in the Big Data Institute at the University of Oxford. Sarah‚Äôs first novel, Lies We Sing to the Sea, became an instant New York Times, indie, and international bestseller. Her second novel, Gentlest of Wild Things, will be published in August 2024. About Lies We sing to the Sea - Rising star Sarah Underwood introduces her immersive debut novel Lies We Sing to the Sea, a sapphic epic inspired by Greek mythology. Be transported to the cursed shores of Ithaca with this tale of love and fate, grief and sacrifice, and, ultimately, the power we must find within. The evening will be chaired by Joanne Hodgson - Joanne is a Hampshire-based book blogger and content producer sharing book reviews, independent bookshop spotlights and literary travel ideas online.When she's not reading, she works within education and is passionate about the transformative impact of great storytelling.Blog: Joanne Reads Bookswww.instagram.com/joannereadsbooks www.x.com/jo_reads_bookswww.tiktok.com/joannereadsbooks www.joannereadsbooks.com Part of the Farnham Literary Festival, Event format - Panel Event Ticket Type - General Admission ¬£10. Tickets still available in store!
Title: Myths and Monsters Panel Event
Subtitle: Join us at Blue Bear Bookshop for a panel event based on Myth's retold as fiction.

Description: Welcome to our Pottery Wheel Fun-damentals Class! Get ready to unleash your creativity in this 1.5-hour session where you'll dive into the exciting world of crafting bowls and cylinders using the potter‚Äôs wheel. Our super friendly and experienced tutor will be there to hold your hand through every spin!Expect to whip up approximately 2 dazzling pieces during this class‚Äîit‚Äôs a blast for beginners! Plus, it's a group affair with a maximum of 4 fellow pottery enthusiasts. Bring a buddy along or come solo to mingle with new friends who share your love for clay and creativity.What‚Äôs in the package?Hands-on guidance from a pottery pro1.5 hours of pure pottery joy and learningLeave with 2 stunning masterpieces created by you!Here's the icing on the clay cake: You have options! Enjoy the sheer joy of the making process for ¬£45, or opt for the full experience by having us bisque fire your pieces in our kiln for an extra ¬£5. Want to jazz them up with decorative glazes? You can come back for an additional session at just ¬£10 per hour.After the fun, you can swing by to pick up your awesome creations within 21 days of your class date. We‚Äôll keep them safe for an extra 30 days!Come join the pottery party‚Äîit's a wheel-y good time!
Title: Introductory Pottery:  Wheel Taster Class
Subtitle: Discover a love of pottery! Join our 1.5hr intro class. Craft bowls/cylinders with expert guidance. Perfect for beginners!

Description: Dive into an exciting and immersive creative experience at Social Pottery! Our sessions are designed for pure enjoyment, relaxation, and unleashing your artistic side. We believe in the power of art to reduce stress, inspire innovation, and connect communities. What's in the package: - Your choice of Pottery Bisque - 2 hours of painting time - 20+ vibrant colours for endless possibilities - Onsite artist assistance It's a creative journey, not a formal art class. Elevate your pottery with our glazes, stencils, stamps, and inspiring books. prepare for your visit and get inspired by visiting our Pinterest and YouTube channel.  Leave your masterpiece with us for a clear glaze and kiln firing. Ready for pickup in 10 days.  Important note:Your pieces are available for collection for 30 days post-event (unclaimed items go to charity). Avoid Saturday pickups between 1-5 pm for a smoother experience.
Title: Pottery Painting  Experience
Subtitle: Discover exciting, stress-reducing art at Social Pottery! Choose pottery, paint for 2 hours, and get creative!

Description: Experience creativity like never before at our boozy Social Pottery! Join us for a relaxing and enjoyable session where you'll unleash your artistic side with your favourite beverage in hand! Discover the power of art in reducing stress, sparking innovation, and fostering connections. What's included: - Your choice of pottery bisque (Our pottery bisques range from ¬£15 to ¬£80) - A dedicated 2.5-hour painting session - Over 20 vibrant colours for endless possibilities - An onsite artist to guide your creative journey Fuel your imagination with a variety of glazes, stencils, stamps, and inspiring books. Avoid Saturday collections between 1-5pm for a smoother experience.

Description: We want to make live music both accessible for everyone, and also financially sustainable for bands and venues. The huge costs of rehearsals and logistics has made smaller bands playing live music financially unsustainable which has lead to many live music venues closing down. We want to change that. This is a free entry gig to ensure it is accessible for everyone, however we are requesting a band support fee of ¬£10 per person. The vast majority of the band support fee from Band Up! nights will go directly to the band (rather than the promoter)  Paying will ensure that the band you are supporting can continue to play gigs and contribes towards the community. Luna in Leytonstone is one of the many grassroots venues which is struggling to stay open.  https://www.bigissue.com/culture/music/luna-music-venue-watch-east-london-crowdfunder-leytonstone/ We are all in this for great nights out, sharing our music with like minded individuals and having a laugh. Let's keep live music alive. Thank you for your support. X
Title: Band up! presents... Live @ Luna Leytonstone 8/3/24.
Subtitle: ¬£10 per person support fee. Click 'Get Tickets' to choose the band to support THE TUESDAYS/JOE CULLEN/NUEVA/TYRE FYRE/GRIZZLEE/SARGENT

Description: Cerus Botanical Designs Floral Artistry Mothers Day WorkshopCome and spend some time in my Botanical Workshop surrounded by woodland calm, and the beauty of nature, while learning a new skill and creating a stunning floral creation. I can't wait to share my love of floristry with you. If you enjoy being creative, or like to try something wonderful and new, this workshop will be perfect for you. It is somewhere you can be brave and let your imagination run wild! What could be more idyllic than a few hours of creative floral fun, tucked away in my BOTANICAL workshop deep in the woods, away from the hustle and bustle of daily life spending some quality time with old and new friends, while learning a new skill, and laughing lots and lots? This workshop is my way of sharing my love of floristry with you. I will share hints and tips I have picked up over more than 20 years of being a florist, and you‚Äôll learn how to create something beautiful, with me by your side to guide you every step of the way. Don't worry if you think you are not creative, you will soon see how creative you really are! Take Care and Much LoveCerus Extra Information All flowers, foliage and some accessories are providedTo keep the workshops cosy, spaces are limited to 7 people.There will be 1 or 2 teachersNo previous experience is requiredWrap up warm and wear sensible flat footwearPlenty of free parking Www.cerusbotanicaldesigns.co.uk
Title: Mothers Day Workshop
Subtitle: If you enjoy being creative, or like to try something wonderful and new, this workshop will be perfect for you.

Description: The National Museum of Computing (TNMOC) is home to the world's largest collection of working historic computers. Purchase an Annual Ticket to visit The National Museum of Computing on this page. This also includes FREE access to our online events. You can also book free STEM sessions during weekends and school holidays using an exclusive discount code once you have purchased your annual ticket! Recognised as one of England‚Äôs Top 100 ‚ÄòIrreplaceable Places‚Äô, The National Museum of Computing (TNMOC) is home to the world's largest collection of working historic computers. Explore Block H: Experience the World-Class Collection at TNMOC! We invite you to embark on an extraordinary journey into the heart of technology at Block H, the home of The National Museum of Computing (TNMOC) on the historic Bletchley Park site. Why Visit TNMOC's Block H? Our Team will be on hand to deliver the stories and full demonstrations of the working exhibits here at The National Museum of Computing, housing the world's largest collection of functional historic computers and WW2 machines, including, Enigma, Lorenz the working Turing-Welchman Bombe, the rebuilt Colossus, the world‚Äôs first electronic computer, and the WITCH, the world's oldest working digital computer. The museum enables visitors to follow the development of computing from the ultra-secret pioneering efforts of the 1940s through the large systems and mainframes of the 1950s, 60s and 70s, and the rise of personal computing in the 1980s and beyond. You will also have the opportunity to explore the galleries showcasing where British Cyber Security started and our computing history. 1. World-Class Working Collection:Witness a remarkable collection of functional historic computers, including iconic machines like Colossus and WITCH, showcasing the evolution of computing from its pioneering days to the present. 2. Exceptional Demonstrations: Be inspired by our exceptional volunteers and staff who will demonstrate the incredible capabilities of these machines. Their passion and expertise bring history to life. 3. Interactive Learning: Immerse yourself in interactive demonstrations that highlight the significance of each machine, offering a hands-on experience that educates and entertains. 4. Inspiring Atmosphere: Feel the vibrant atmosphere of innovation and discovery as you explore the technological marvels that have shaped the digital world we live in today. Join us and witness the magic of computing history coming to life. Whether you're a technology enthusiast, a history buff, or simply curious, this experience promises to be enlightening and engaging. We look forward to welcoming you to TNMOC's Block H, where the past meets the future in the world of computing. We recommend that you allow a minimum of two hours for your visit. Please note, your ticket allows entry to the museum all day, with first entry at 10:30 and last entry at 15:30. Cancellation Policy: We can accept cancellations and issue a refund up to 48 hours prior to your visit. Alternatively, we are always very happy to transfer your tickets to the next available/suitable date. This can be done at any point up to the day of the event. Please Note: We are unable to issue a refund to no shows. Support Us: We are charity, To make a donation in support of our ongoing mission to 'Conserve, Educate and Engage', please visit: https://www.tnmoc.org/make-a-donation. Alternatively, you might like to:
Title: ANNUAL Tickets - The National Museum of Computing on Bletchley Park
Subtitle: ANNUAL tickets to visit The National Museum of Computing on Bletchley Park

Description: Join us for the Richat Structure/Eye of the Sahara Photography Tour! Get ready to embark on a captivating journey through the mesmerizing landscapes of the Richat Structure, also known as the Eye of the Sahara. This event is a dream come true for photography enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. Starting on Fri Mar 08 2024 at 10:00:00 GMT+0000 (Greenwich Mean Time), 10 The tour promises to be an unforgettable experience, filled with breathtaking sights and incredible photo opportunities. During this in-person event, you will have the chance to explore the unique geological formation of the Richat Structure, renowned for its striking circular shape. As you wander through the Sahara desert, you'll be captivated by the vibrant colors, intricate patterns, and vastness of this natural wonder. Whether you're an amateur photographer or a seasoned professional, our knowledgeable guides will be there to provide valuable tips and tricks to help you capture the perfect shot. You'll have ample time to unleash your creativity and immortalize the beauty of this awe-inspiring location. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to witness the Richat Structure/Eye of the Sahara in all its glory. Book your spot now and get ready for an unforgettable photography adventure!
Title: Richat Structure/Eye of the Sahara Photography tour
Subtitle: We're thrilled to introduce the *ONLY* photography tour that takes you to the Richat Structure, in the remote desert of Mauritania.

Description: Awaken your mind and body to a new level and learn how to practice meditation in motion. The purpose of this yoga lineage is to guide you toward cultivating a conscious connection, integration and awakening of the body, mind, heart and spirit. You will learn and practice Patanjali's 8 limbs of yoga: Work primarily with the Amrit posture sequence, gentle vinyasa flows and extended posture holding times. Explore the deepest levels of body, mind and spirit with the integrative practices of clear intention, breath, meditative awareness and conscious integration. Learn to balance your nervous system with the ‚Äúfirst half‚Äù and ‚Äúsecond half‚Äù of a posture. To transition from an active state of ‚Äúdoing‚Äù a posture, to a relaxed state of ‚Äúbeing‚Äù. And to feel the effects of a posture. Learn to consciously encounter your "edge" of body and mind to release deep tensions and restore the natural flow of the vital life force energy (prana). Good for all levels, from those with some experience to more experienced practitioners. Some experience with yoga and postures is recommended. BIOGRAPHY I have been guiding spiritual seekers for over 30 years with the self-transformative teachings of yoga, meditation, Ayurveda and breathing. It is my pleasure and honor to guide you toward self-empowerment, transformation and awakened consciousness. I will help you connect to your deepest self and inner guide, from the physical to the soul dimension. SOULDIMENSION.ORG Copyright ¬© 2022 ‚Ä¢ Soul Dimension
Title: Awakening Yoga ‚Ä¢ Weekly Class ‚Ä¢ Preston
Subtitle: Weekly online class with a spiritual focus to awaken one‚Äôs consciousness and highest potential.

Description: Follow the link for more Awaken You BreathRAVE events. On this special night you will experience deep concious connected breathwork that will light up your life energy and put in touch with your higher self. There will be a LIVE soundbath with sining bowles, drums and chimes and ofcourse there will be movement and dance to banging tunes, in a room full of lush humans. About our Soundbath and dance, what you can expect. The Healing Melodies of a Sound Bath, In the midst of the chaos and turmoil of our modern lives, seekers of tranquility and repose turn to unique practices that can help restore balance to the mind, body, and spirit. One such practice gaining popularity is the indulgence in a sound bath. Far beyond simply soaking the senses with enchanting melodies, a sound bath offers a profound journey of relaxation and healing. What to expect - Being among other beautiful people, endless possibilities and the potential for a life-changing, awakening experience and ofcourse, the unexpected. Lots of guided, conscious, coherent and connected breathing to instruction to carefully selected music. A team to care for you. What to bring - Please bring an eye covering or mask, An open mind, bottle of water, note pad if you wish to journal, a yoga mat, a pillow and a blanket. What to wear - Anything you feel comfortable in however this event it's likley you will get nice and warm and move around. Note - You need to be in a state of mental and physical health appropriate to attend this event. If in doubt, please consult your medical professional. If you have any cardiovascular disease, epilepsy, recently had an operation or are in recovery from a break, fracture or other illness, this may not be appropriate for you at this time. If unsure please get in touch. If you are displaying any cold of flu symptoms, please do not attend. By purchasing this ticket you are agreeing that you are fit, healthy to attend this breathwork event and have none of the above contraindications. We are fully trained and insured to run breathwork events, and first aid trained. If we can master our breathing we will master our body, mind and spirit. What people are saying. Nothing had prepared me for the experience of the first breath work session I went to with Mac. It exceeded every expectation I had. Mac was warm and welcoming and reassuring that everything I was experiencing was normal for the process. Having reconnected with myself, I left feeling the happiest I could remember. I could hardly wait to get to the next one. Thank you Mac. Amanda Ridley - Little Friston Retreat I was lucky enough to attend a recent Awaken You session. I've dipped into cold water exposure before but I haven't explored much breathwork and I was intrigued. I cannot believe what happened when all we did was breath. That night I slept for 9 hours and in the morning my body battery was 98% - neither of which have ever happened before. I cannot recommend this enough, truly mind-blowing stuff. Go with an open mind and you'll be surprised as to what will happen. Just wow. Chris - Tec Company CEO I hadn‚Äôt really done breathwork before, but I was astounded by the power of each session, comparable in depth and intensity to an ayahuasca retreat, if not more so. Deep seated issues and emotions arose but were worked through and transmuted during the sessions themselves without any real effort or need to analyse or intellectually work things out. I get a strong sense that continue breathwork could be hugely effective in dissolving and unburdening me of unresolved issues, literally allowing life to be a lot lighter, and to equip me to be of better service to the people around me. Gavin - Brighton
Title: Brighton BreathRAVE - Breathwork, Sound bath, Meditation, Movement & Dance
Subtitle: Brighton BreathRAVE is our deep breathwork event, an evening of Awaken You Breathwork, Movement, Dance, Sound bath & meditation.

Description: Join a bespoke Emergency First Aid one day course made especially for Writing Our Legacy, delivered by Elements First Aid on Saturday, 9th of March 9am - 5pm @ Saddlescombe Farm, Brighton. Training is valued at ¬£75 per person, a ¬£25 non-refundable deposit will be required to secure the space. If the participant is on no or low income, this ¬£25 deposit will be returned after attendance. *Disclaimer* Location:Saddlescombe Farm, Brighton Access:Anyone on low or no income will be offered free lunch and help with transport.We can also offer help with childcare / access support. For further information or questions please email info@writingourlegacy.org.uk. Part of the Changing Chalk programme. Writing Our Legacy CIC is an arts and heritage organisation that enables Black, Asian and ethnically diverse/BPOC* people to tell their story through writing and the creative arts. We were established in 2012. We give writers and other creatives a platform and community to feel supported, nurtured and evolve their work through the creative pipeline, from start to publication. We share stories and heritage of diaspora communities and bring them to life through various art forms for audiences to learn and take part in cultural heritage. We are an Arts Council England National Portfolio Organisation. *BPOC stands for ‚ÄòBlack people, People of Colour‚Äô and is a self-identifying term. While we use the term BPOC, we acknowledge the limitations of this terminology. At the core of our network is the aim to address and overcome systemic barriers that our members face directly or indirectly based on their ethnic or national identities, race or perceived racial identities, or the colour of their skin as per the Equality Act of 2010. This includes people who identify as Black, brown, people of colour, Global Majority, mixed-race, multiple heritage and/or are from the Global South, and/or are East and South-East Asian, West Asian, Asian, Middle Eastern, African, African-Caribbean, Caribbean, Latinx, Pacific Islander, Indigenous, or First Nations, and diasporas.
Title: Course: Emergency First Aid (EFAW + Outdoor)
Subtitle: A fully accredited one day course, containing elements of First Aid at Work and Outdoor First Aid, delivered by Elements First Aid training.

Refund_Policy: No Refunds
Description: DANCE MUSIC SPACE For the MUSIC... For the DANCE... and the SPACE to be. Conscious dance space, proper club sounds. Clubbing meets conscious dance. Conscious dance meets the club. Combining the best of conscious dance with the best of the club- uniting together in a liberating, freeing, life-affirming way. MUSIC: From soft atmospheric sweeps, through beautiful organic house beats, to hard and driving underground techno and high-energy ecstatic release. A range of quality electronic music, to support our dance/movement. The best (though not necessarily most well-known) electronic dance music out there. Blended in a seamlessly-mixed DJ set- an immersive and cyclic journey of sound. Unconstrained by genre. Here we can lose ourselves- and find ourselves afresh, and anew. Club-level DJing provides the right energy for discerning music enthusiasts on the dance floor. It's called 'dance music' for a reason- and we're here to dance. To move through the soundscape. To rekindle that flame. To bring things back to the roots, and together, elevate and uplift! The music guides, taking us up, and back down again. We follow our inner compass. DANCE: In a purposefully held, sober dance space. With others who share the same love of the music and intention to move. To stretch, to shake, to let go and to expand. Beyond self- and societally- imposed limits. And beyond the restrictions of a club environment, in which the scope for movement might feel limited, compared to the permission we offer ourselves and each other in the conscious dance space. We all move. We don't have to consider ourselves 'dancers.' We all 'dance' our way through life. By ourselves- and in meaningful community. Whether we consider ourselves seasoned dancers or not, we bring with us a willingness to explore. To be with the various aspects of ourselves in movement. With no requirement to move in any particular way. We don't have to be any particular way, so long as we are respectful of ourselves and each other in the space. No-one to please, or get it right for. Whether we're still, or wild- or somewhere in between. Finding our feet as we go. SPACE: Some verbal guidance may be offered, particularly in the warm up... but this is primarily a space in which we find our own feet, dropping into the callings, longings, and creativity of our own Spirit. We give ourselves time and space to be here. To get present. To honour the different rhythms that run through us. Just as the physical space of the venue holds us and our dances- being the container for all that we feel and express- so too, we ourselves are the holding-space for all that we feel and move with. We include it all in our awareness and experience. Witnessing and riding both flowing and edgy, hard and soft, peaceful and wild, integrated or not. It's a spectrum. There is range. Within which to locate ourselves. An organic unfolding. Naturally-arising. Join us in the Auditorium at the Brighthelm Centre in Brighton, for a DEEPER DANCE JOURNEY through sound and motion. It's a wonderfully big, light, centrally-located and easily-accessible space. Answering the call to explore our movement, to dance our own dance, here we enjoy the vast and living potential of freedom in motion. Bring yourself. Bring friends. Know that you are most welcome here. And let us continue to co-create something beautiful and powerful together!
Title: DANCE MUSIC SPACE
Subtitle: Calling all dancers and electronic music lovers! Get ready to move at DANCE MUSIC SPACE, where conscious dance meets top-quality club music.

Description: Joanna Cooke ‚Äì VocalsMark Edwards ‚Äì KeysTristan Banks - DrumsNathan Austin - GuitarMark Prentice - Bass ‚ÄúRising star soul/jazz singer with a blues heart. A name to watch'" Jon Newey, Jazzwise‚ÄúThat warm flashback sound that'll make good company with Aretha Franklins early '70's sides." SoulTracks.com USA‚ÄúIt catches you in the feels in a way that the likes of Adele would kill for..‚Äù Listen With Monger" ..a voice that drips with soul. Joanna takes a song and layers it over you like warm honey until it floats you away" - Dart Music Festival Motown legend Martha Reeves summed it up perfectly, describing Joanna Cooke as ‚Äúthe baby girl singing the blues". Joanna, much like her South West counterpart Joss Stone demonstrates that true soul and emotional connection is not simply constrained by colour or creed. Moreover, her self-penned songs leave a lasting impression on audiences, by dint of their raw honesty and song craft. Drive and talent combined with her contemporary sound blending Soul, Jazz & Blues now see Joanna performing festivals and notable venues around the UK and supporting big name artists like Tom Jones, Rag N Bone Man, Martha Reeves, Paloma Faith + the likes of Mamas Gun, Beth Rowley, Jo Harman & Martin Harley. At The Verdict Joanna will perform her recent 'Kaleidoscope' EP (produced by Brighton based musician & polymath Mark Edwards), several other popular tracks from her 3 previous records & a couple of classic covers which showcase her influences. Tracks from 'Kaleidoscope' Earned spots in the UK Soul Music Charts' Top 30 plus entries in 2 other UK Soul/RnB charts.Here's what Blues in Britain had to say about it -"I first found Joanna Cooke in the musical feast of her 'Kaleidoscope' collection, delivering a diverse array of musical emotion - imploring soul of Good Lover, the haunting angst of Caught Up, gospel chord progressions of Haven‚Äôt You Heard taking the blues back to church, the shimmering sensitivity of Like A Lover, the hustling soulful recovery of Still Healing and pouring her heart out on Falling a Little ‚Äì whichever way you turn, Joanna spells soul with a capital ‚ÄòJ‚Äô!! Clive Richardson (Blues In Britain) After recently supporting Matt Johnson (Jamiroquai) at his sold out show at Jazz Cafe London, Joanna is excited to bring a wonderfully talented set of musicians together to perform her music at this leading Brighton Jazz Venue.
Title: Joanna Cooke Band Live at The Verdict Jazz Club
Subtitle: Joanna Cooke Band Live at The Verdict Jazz Club

Description: 16th March 2024 ‚Äì BRIGHTON DUB CLUB IS BACK AT THE KOMEDIA Brighton Dub Clubs return to the Komedia. Get your monthly medicine of Roots & Culture played on an handcrafted heavyweight sound system. We are up for a treat for this one with as a very special guest, Ampfreqq maestra Kiki Slawter ### KIKI SLAWTER ### Kiki Slawter represents the best of the new generation. She is a seasoned selector who has been playing in UK and abroad in many dances with her unique style. She uses and master Ampfreqq and will do live mixing and dubbings, adding an extra dimensions to the music she plays. Expect killer tunes with a twist and high energy! ### DENDE SOUND ### Based in Brighton - UK, Dende Sound is a lovingly crafted, custom-built heavyweight Sound System inspired by a long tradition of Jamaican and UK Sound Systems.Dende Sound has been putting on regular dances hosting visiting crews representing the best in Reggae and Dub. They played alongside many artists and crews all over UK (Maasai Warrior, Jah Youth, Brother Culture, Rebel Lion, Roots Youth Records, Earthquake, Emperor DT, Nomadix to name a few) and are always up to play and share their high energy and their roots, dub and dubplates selection. They became a cornerstone on the UK Roots scene. They also created their record label (Dende Sound Records) in 2020In 2022, Edi Yoyo started setting up Dende Sound System in Gambia and every year he spend few month over there to develop the sound and work with local artists.Bambaman and MC Trooper will represent for this dance as Edi Yoyo is setting up and developing the sound system in Gambia. + MCs and players of instruments TBC This is set to be another uplifting night of bass, mids and tops rumbling the building and healing our souls. More Love! More Life!! More Fyah!!! REFUND POLICY: NO REFUND UNLESS THE GIG IS CANCELLED
Title: BRIGHTON DUB CLUB - DENDE SOUND meets KIKI SLAWTER
Subtitle:
Brighton Dub Clubs return to the Komedia. 

Get your monthly medicine of Roots & Culture played on an handcrafted heavyweight sound system.

Description: Do you or someone you know have aches, discomfort, or frequent pain? Do you have problems with posture, stiffness, or tension? Do you feel stressed, anxious, or overwhelmed, or perhaps just want to do something wholesome and healthy for yourself? Whether you wish to improve or just maintain your well-being this workshop will provide you with skills to support mental and physical well-being take part in this radical act of self love. In this workshop I will share with you, simple techniques from a range of skills and knowledge I have gained over the past 19yrs working in well-being. Drawing on my own experience to help you create a more sensitive, soothing, and compassionate touch. As well as simple postures and meditative breathing from yoga, explorations of the body from body-psychotherapy and Qi gong, whilst using the mind to scan through the body, deepening relaxation and making affirmations for positive health. We will work gently through a sequency starting with light awareness of the breath and feeling into the whole body, then use some movement to open out the body and then go deeper into those areas that hold the most tension with massage techniques. We will use props: bolsters, blankets, blocks, and massage ball, to assist our relaxation. It sounds like a lot, but it really is simple when you know how. At the same time for those of you that get bored meditating there is plenty to hold your interest. Altogether, this will be a fun and even powerful experience, which is deeply restorative and best of all, you will learn something you can do for yourself. #selflove #selfhealing #selfcompassion On the day, eat light before the session. You may bring a small snack if required, such as fruit or oat bar you can have after. There will be a short water break. Wear comfortable clothes, layers are useful to regulate your temperature. In addition, it is important to fill in a consultation form before the session. This can be done online (please email me on jbwzoe@gmail.com when you buy your ticket and I will send over an attached form to print) or beforehand (arrive early on the day to do so). With 19yrs experience as a massage therapist, a Bsc in Psychology and qualified Vajrasati Yoga teacher, Zoe understands the importance of the mind-body equilibrium. She is passionate about her job and is always interested in learning more about subjects such as sleep and pain. Using her intuitive approach to the energy systems of the body, as well as her robust knowledge of anatomy and physiology combined with her work in movement and breath, she has created an exceptional workshop, which people of all levels of health and mobility would benefit from.
Title: Therapeutic Movement & Self-Massage Workshop
Subtitle: This workshop is a radical act of self-love!  Connect to nature through your body and breath! Learning to tap into your own healing touch...

Description: Awaken your mind and body to a new level and learn how to practice meditation in motion. The purpose of this yoga lineage is to guide you toward cultivating a conscious connection, integration and awakening of the body, mind, heart and spirit. You will learn and practice Patanjali's 8 limbs of yoga: Work primarily with the Amrit posture sequence, gentle vinyasa flows and extended posture holding times. Explore the deepest levels of body, mind and spirit with the integrative practices of clear intention, breath, meditative awareness and conscious integration. Learn to balance your nervous system with the ‚Äúfirst half‚Äù and ‚Äúsecond half‚Äù of a posture. To transition from an active state of ‚Äúdoing‚Äù a posture, to a relaxed state of ‚Äúbeing‚Äù. And to feel the effects of a posture. Learn to consciously encounter your "edge" of body and mind to release deep tensions and restore the natural flow of the vital life force energy (prana). Good for all levels, from those with some experience to more experienced practitioners. Some experience with yoga and postures is recommended. BIOGRAPHY I have been guiding spiritual seekers for over 30 years with the self-transformative teachings of yoga, meditation, Ayurveda and breathing. It is my pleasure and honor to guide you toward self-empowerment, transformation and awakened consciousness. I will help you connect to your deepest self and inner guide, from the physical to the soul dimension. SOULDIMENSION.ORG Copyright ¬© 2022 ‚Ä¢ Soul Dimension
Title: Awakening Yoga ‚Ä¢ Weekly Class ‚Ä¢ Basingstoke
Subtitle: Weekly online class with a spiritual focus to awaken one‚Äôs consciousness and highest potential.

Description: The Pixel Bunker is the must-visit gaming experience in Milton Keynes. Home to original and lovingly restored arcade machines it is a Mecca for anyone who loves video games. All the classics are here and playable - Pacman, Donkey Kong, Outrun, Track & Field, Street Fighter 2, Bubble Bobble and many, many more machines from the 80's, 90's and 2000's. Gaming sessions last for three hours and once you have paid the entry fee, every game inside is set to free play - no need for any coins to play!
Title: The Pixel Bunker Retro Arcade - January to March 2024
Subtitle: The ultimate arcade experience is here in Milton Keynes!

Description: This invitation is extended to anyone familiar with the practice of shamanic journeying, whether you're a newcomer or have experienced it before. Join us as we delve deeper into this transformative work, allowing ourselves to remember, heal, and strengthen our connection with the spirits. This gathering emphasizes the importance of community, offering an opportunity to explore and understand both the spirits and ourselves more profoundly. Through guided journeys, rhythmic drumming, movement, and ceremonial practices, we will foster a space to trust our instincts and embark on a collective journey of self-discovery and spiritual connection.  For the day is ¬£75. I like to work with a small group and places are limited for comfort in a cosy cabin in Wallingford, Oxfordshire. Plant based lunch is provided along with drinks and snacks. I have been healing people using these ancient tools for many years. It is a passion of mine to pass on my knowledge to give more people the tools to heal themselves and use this powerful method in their every day life. I have trained within the Sacred Trust and School of ecstatic movement. Throughout the years I have assisted tall eachers from both schools. I am an artist, movement teacher, fashion designer and sweatlodge leader.
Title: Deepening your connection
Subtitle: Deepening your connection with shamanic journeying in South Oxfordshire on Saturday 9th March

Description: We are super excited to open our doors to the gamers of Cambridge for a board game night lead by our games expert Karl, here at Waterstones Cambridge. Some notes of the event: - Please use the back entrance of Waterstones facing Hobson Street for signing in - You will have access to our well cultivated library of games on two trolleys - Karl will be running demos throughout the evening, perfect for those wanting to get in game with others - There will also be the opportunity to sign up for specific games, including Blood on the Clocktower (these are booked on the website in addition to General Admission and are free of charge) - Double Points Rewards are available to Waterstones loyalty card holders on any games purchases during the event The event will use the second floor cafe area. Please note, the cafe will not be open during the event. Until this changes, please feel free to bring refreshments.
Title: Games Night in Cambridge
Subtitle: We are super excited to open our doors to the gamers of Cambridge for a board game night lead by our games expert Karl!

Description: What to Expect: The workshop will begin by finding a comfortable space to settle into, either seated or lying down, as Emily leads a brief meditation to help centre your mind and body. Following this, immerse yourself in a transformative sound journey guided by various instruments, including the gentle tones of Tibetan Singing Bowls, customised to meet the needs of participants in the room. As the soothing vibrations penetrate deeply, Emily‚Äôs calming voice gently brings you back to awareness, concluding the session. Afterwards, enjoy the opportunity to share your thoughts and reflections while sipping on herbal tea, fostering integration and reflection. Benefits: Research shows that sound healing can rewire the brain, promoting overall well-being. Throughout history, music has been a powerful tool for uplifting mood and fostering holistic healing. Participants often experience increased energy, mental clarity, creativity, and improved relationships with themselves and others. Additionally, sound healing can help reduce stress, lower heart rate, alleviate pain and inflammation, and improve sleep quality and life balance. What to Bring: Wear comfortable, warm clothing to stay cosy during meditation. ‚Ä¢ Bring a cushion or pillow for added comfort, along with a blanket for warmth. ‚Ä¢ Feel free to bring extra props like yoga blocks, cushions, bolsters, or an eye pillow for personalised comfort. ‚Ä¢ While yoga mats are available, you‚Äôre encouraged to bring your own for a touch of familiarity. Embark on a journey of self-discovery and empowerment with Emily‚Äôs tailored workshop, where the healing power of sound awaits to nurture and revitalise your inner being.
Title: 60 Minute Sound Meditation for Kids & Teens (10-16 years old)
Subtitle: Join for an empowering workshop designed specifically for youth aged 10-16 years old, focusing on stress, anxiety reduction, relaxation
